loans.name: Sarala

texts.en:
Sarala is from the small village of Falakata in the Alipurduar district. Her family consists of her husband and her two sons. She is a 35-year-old housewife, who studied up to grade 6. Sarala and her husband, Jagadish, are involved with farming. This is an important source of income for them. They grow vegetables and sell the produce in the local market. Thus they can manage household expenses.

As life gets more expensive day by day, Sarala and her husband want to increase their income. They want to cultivate cucumbers, which is a popular vegetable. They need financial help to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies for cucumber cultivation.

Sarala is seeking a loan from Kiva via Belghoria Janakalyan Samity to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way. She expects a good harvest with the help of this loan. Sarala is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for cucumber cultivation.

loans.name: Kolini

texts.en: Kolini is a 27-year-old single woman with no children. She would like to start growing tomatoes and cabbages to earn a living. Kolini has requested a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, and rakes. She has been a member of SPBD for two years. Kolini will spend her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, and rakes

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Lucia has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from food-vending. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marrisa

texts.en:
Marrisa, a 47-year-old married woman with eight children, two of whom are presently in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has operated a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines for 10 years.

Marrisa has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi lives in Vanadzor city with her school-aged children. Her husband is abroad working in the Russian Federation and helps Varduhi to support their family's needs. Varduhi is a loved and respected teacher in her city of Vanadzor. She has more than 20 years experience as a teacher of Armenian language and literature in one of the secondary schools in Vanadzor. 

Besides teaching in school, Varduhi organizes private teaching in her home. She prepares the students for graduation and entrance examinations. She confessed that teaching and preparing after the work day in school is very hard, but at the same time it is a very important activity. Varduhi is seeking a loan in order to buy a new computer and professional literature, which will help her to develop her professional skills.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and professional literature, which will help her to develop her professional skills

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 31 years old and married with one child. Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and other personal care products. Marjorie has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and other personal care products

loans.name: Venghai Group

texts.en:
Sihan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Sihan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Sihan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Sihan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Seioaiga

texts.en: Seioaiga is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a small business, selling pancakes in her community, and has been doing this for two years. Seioaiga has applied for a loan to buy a frying pan, a gas oven, containers, cooking oil, flour, yeast, and other items. She joined SPBD in June this year (2015) to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seioaiga will help to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy  a frying pan, a gas oven, containers, cooking oil, flour, yeast, and other items.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny, 59 years old and married, has been farming rice in the Philippines for 15 years now. She has taken seven previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business and is now requesting a new one for PHP 12000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenny would like to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria tiene 36 años de edad tiene un hijo de 16 años con el vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la agricultura, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para la siembra de papas, gracias al crédito podra mejorar sus cultivos y obtener mas ingresos para poder sustetar a su hijo, los desafios a los que se enfrenta es el mal tiempo el cual puede dañar los cultivos, en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarle a su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old and has a 16 year-old son, with whom she lives in Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar. She works in agriculture and is requesting the loan in order to purchase agricltural supplies to plant potatoes.

Thanks to the loan she will be able to improve her crops and earn more income in order to take care of her son. The challenge she faces is bad weather, which can damage the crops. In her free time, she likes to be with her son.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel, 42 years old, is married and has two children. Liezel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and personal care products. Liezel has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she also earns an income from pig fattening. Liezel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and personal care products.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian works hard to support her family. She is married, has four children, and operates a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Vivian applied for a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for two years, and she also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to build and expand her business, in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Naxay Group

texts.en:
Nuanta and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. Nuanta and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totaling up the costs, he and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the TerraClear water filter would have for them and their families.

Nuanta is excited the water filter that was chosen was available on an affordable payment plan. The filter is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Clearly, it will benefit a large number of people in the community.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Vangnao Group

texts.en: Xiengkham is excited that this water filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Xiengkham and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Xiengkham and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years, and is known to function for up to five years. Xiengkham and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totaling up the costs, Xiengkham and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will bring to them and their families.

loans.use: to buy a TerraClear water filter, to gain access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una madre de 49 años de edad, es amable generosa y muy trabajadora  que vive junto a sus dos hijos de las edades entre 16 y 20 años en una comunidad  de  San Miguelito.
Catarina (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa negra) para poder obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y cubrir mejor las necesidades de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de café, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 12 años, gracias al esmero, decisión y empeño que le pone a sus cultivos con las ganancias que generan han sacado adelante a su familia.
Catarina a pesar de ser una mujer muy trabajadora del campo, tiene mucho liderazgo es por ello que un grupo de mujeres han confiado en ella para que sea ella quien los represente para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirán en el mantenimiento de café y pagar la de mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes para poder obtener una buena cosecha al final de la temporada.
Catarina tiene el anhelo de seguir sembrando plantaciones de café y mejorar sus ingresos para el bien de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 49 year old mother. She is generous, friendly and very hard-working. She lives with her two children aged 16 and 20 in a community of San Miguelito.

Catarina (the first to the right in the photo wearing a black blouse) works selling coffee in order to obtain her income and help her husband with the household expenses and to pay for the expenses of her children. She has done this work for 12 years and thanks to her determination, decisiveness and effort that she puts into her crops she has gotten her family ahead with the profits she generates.

Catarina in spite of being a hard-working country woman has leadership qualities. So a group of people had confidence in her to represent them to request a loan which she will invest in the maintenance of her coffee. She will pay for labor and buy fertilizer to be able to reap a good harvest at the end of the season. Catarina hopes to continue planting coffee and improve her income for the good of her beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nonglamchan Group

texts.en: Maneevanh’s village obtains much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without boiling. Maneevanh and her group are excited that this water filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can devote to other pursuits. Maneevanh and her fellow villagers also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, the filter users, including Maneevanh’s family, expect a substantial decrease in illness and the associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to gain access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Erkinoy

texts.ru: Эркиной веселая и счастливая семья. Она мама и бабушка. У нее не большая семья. Муж занимается таксистом. Сыновья работают в банке. Невестка домохозяйка ведет домашнее хозяйство. Сама Эркиной занимается животноводством у себя во дворе. У нее тоже имеется источник доход. Эркиной более 15 лет занимается своим бизнесом. Ей на работе помогает ее муж. Она покупает скота и откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Эркиной любить выращивать скота. Она хочет приобрести еще пару коров для увеличения их численность. Эркиной надеется путем увеличения поголовье скота расшириться ее бизнес. И доход от животноводство позволит ей улучшить условия жизни семью.
texts.en: Erkinoy is from a cheerful and happy family. She is a mother and grandmother. She has a small family. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her sons work in a bank. Her daughter-in-law is a homemaker and looks after the house. Erkinoy herself rears animals in her yard. She also has her source of income. Erkinoy has been doing this business for over 15 years. Her husband helps her work. She buys livestock and fattens them for a few months, then resells them at the livestock market. Erkinoy loves to raise animals. She wants to buy another couple of cows to increase her herd. Erkinoy hopes that by increasing her herd she will expand her business. The income from rearing animals will enable her to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS REYNAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rudt, la socia continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua preparando diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, aceite, arroz entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people belong to the “LAS REYNAS” communal bank. It is located in the district of Maranura, which belongs to the province of La Convención and Cusco department.

Rudt is one member. She continues with her restaurant business. She has been working in this business for years and things are going well thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She continues to prepare different dished like chicken with potatoes, soups and meat stir-fries for all her clients that request them. She wants to continue to work in order to continue supporting her family. She is requesting the loan to buy meat, oil and rice amongst others.

The other members work in animal sales, a cattle business, a grocery store and a restaurant. Rudt is grateful to those that form part of this dream through this loan and promises to pay her installments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil and rice amongst others.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia continua con su negocio  de tienda de abarrotes, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia continua trabajando para apoyar  a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, leche entre otros.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
Group member Celia belongs to the communal bank VELASCO ASTETE.

She is continuing with her grocery store business that she has been operating for some time. It is working well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. This is how she continues working to support her family. 

She is grateful for the loan offered to her and committed to meeting the established payment schedule. She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, and similar items.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and similar items.

loans.name: Namarkmy Group

texts.en:
Inthawa’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Inthawa and her group, Namarkmy Group, are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now Inthawa can shift to other pursuits.  

Inthawa and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Inthawa’s family, expect a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Doreli

texts.es:
Doreli tiene 35 años de edad,conviviente , vive con su conyugue y sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Doreli se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la mejora en la estructura del corral de los mismo. Con esto Doreli espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doreli is 35 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives with her partner and her two children in the rural part of the district of Oyotún which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Doreli works raising and selling small animals like chickens, hens, ducks and turkeys amongst others. Her business is located at her house. She has ten years of experience in this work and has very good personal and work references from the district.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy greater quantity of animals and improve her enclosure for them. Doing this Doreli wants to offer a better product to her clients which will allow her to generate greater income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy  greater quantity of animals and improve her enclosure for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new merchandise like tomatoes, onion, potatoes, cilantro, etc. to increase his sales and income.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leslie is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Leslie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Leslie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Luz has been in this business for eight years now.She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a 61-year-old married woman with five children who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 10 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and  personal care products.

Jelly has previously borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF.  She earns additional income selling rice.

Jelly aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and personal care products.

loans.name: Tho Group

texts.en:
Kit understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Kit knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water requires natural and financial resources.  The water filter Kit purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost to obtain firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water.    

Kit is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years.  He and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters.

loans.name: Dongbang Group

texts.en:
Nat is excited that the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Nat and his group participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and bottled water were discussed and priced  over a  2-year period.  The water filter Nat and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Nat and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. 

And after totaling the costs, Nat and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters.

loans.name: Bergie

texts.en:
Bergie is  41-year-old married woman with one child who works hard to provide for her family.

Bergie has run a general store for 8 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and personal care products.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, and personal care products.

loans.name: Azatuhi

texts.en:
Azatuhi is from the city of Vanadzor which is  the Lori region of Armenia. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. She has been a music teacher for many years. 

Now Azatuhi works in an outpatient clinic as a nurse. Her husband is a driver and together provide for their family. 

Azatuhi needs a loan of 350.000 AMD for her daughter’s surgery procedures and medical treatment. Azatuhi hopes that with Kiva lenders' support, her daughter will overcome her health problems.

loans.use: for her daughter’s surgery procedures and medical treatment.

loans.name: Maria Clemencia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Clemencia una señora de 46 años, habita en casa propia junto a su hija, una joven mayor de edad que ya es independiente.
Clemencia se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y calzado, lleva años en este negocio que comenta que gracias a él ha podido salir adelante, darle la educación a su hija y mejorar poco a poco a poco su casa; dice que es porque ha sabido manejarlo muy bien, entregándose a su trabajo diario.
Clemencia es cliente de Fundación Alternativa, es una excelente clienta, con el primer crédito pudo comprar mercadería, ahora solicita nuevamente ya que quiere viajar a Pelileo para traer ropa más económica ya que estamos en la temporada estudiantil y cerca de las fiestas del cantón, es cuando su clientela le pide mayor variedad. Dice que es muy buena temporada para ella, con estas ganancias desea seguir creciendo y mejorando su negocio para darle las pautas necesarias a su hija para que sea una microempresaria de éxito.
texts.en:
In the city of Santo Domingo lives Clemencia, a 46-year-old lady. She lives in a house of her own with her daughter, a young woman of age who is already independent. Clemencia makes a living selling clothes, cosmetics, and footwear. She has spent years in this business. She says that thanks to it, she has been able to move forward to give her daughter an education and to improve, little by little, her home; she says it's because she has managed it very well, devoting herself to her daily work.

Clemencia is a client of Fundación Alternativa [Alternative Foundation]; she is an excellent client. With the first loan, she was able to buy merchandise. She is now requesting again since she wants to travel to Pelileo to bring cheaper clothes as we are in the student season and around the Cantón festivities, when her customers ask for greater variety. 

She says it's a very good season for her. With these earnings, she wishes to continue growing and improving her business to give the necessary guidelines to her daughter so she'll be a successful micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (clothing) and grow as a micro-entrepreneur together with her daughter.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married and works hard to support her family by selling fish for  10 years. 

Rosita requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.  She earns additional income operating a general store.

She would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Phosy Group

texts.en:
Boundeua’s villagers sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without first being boiled.  

Boundeua and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Boundeua and the villagers also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years.  The families should notice a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters.

loans.name: Ausaga

texts.en:
Ausaga is 52 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes and popcorn in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Ausaga has requested a loan to buy flour, corn seeds, cooking oil, a gas oven and containers etc. She joined SPBD in June this year (2015) to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Ausaga will save for unexpected emergencies and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn seeds, cooking oil, a gas oven and containers etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the new semester for her B.Sc. in Information Technology

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, 45, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia and has four children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business; primary grows rice and sells the corps to local dealers. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day. So far, she has been in this type of business for around twenty years.

For supplementary income, she wants to raise a cow for sale. Because there is not enough money, she is applying for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a cow. With the supporting from this loan, she hopes that it will help to increase her income. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy a cow, to help increase her daily income from $2 a day.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es: Martín, tiene la edad  de 60 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Martín is 60 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children, who are his main priority.

With the loan he intends to purchase fertilizers and other products to use in his coffee crops so that they develop well. He also will pay for labor to apply the products and get assistance with the plantation once his harvest is ready, and thus ensure a job well done.

His aim is to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions of the region for this crop and also to put the experience of many years managing coffee into practice. Besides being able to purchase the best quality products so that his plantation develops well and is healthy, he hopes it produces an adequate harvest, and that he has significant short-term production.

He wants to use the income he expects to get from the harvest for the wellbeing of his family, to achieve some family goals, and to continue to invest more in the crops. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not ever taken other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate..

loans.use: to pay for assistance with his coffee crops.

loans.name: Kokkam Group

texts.en:
Vungkithor understands the difference that a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Vungkithor knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Vungkithor purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost to obtain firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water.    

Vungkithor is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years.  He and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters.

loans.name: Leonada

texts.en:
Leonada is a 55-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has sold bananas for 3 years.  She requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy bananas to sell in the market.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Phonedoo Group

texts.en: Heuang is excited that the  filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Heuang and his group participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and bottled water were discussed and priced over a 2-year period.  The water filter Heuang and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Heuang and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. And after totaling the costs, Heuang and his group recognized the substantial financial savings that a water filter will provide.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters.

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faave is a 20-year-old woman who has sold banana chips and german buns for 3 years. 

Faavae has requested a loan to  buy flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder,and oven-proof containers. She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faacae will financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder,and oven-proof containers.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, 53, lives in Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia and has three children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural product to local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, he is able to make an income of 2.00 USD a day.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides for his rice crop

loans.name: Fuatai

texts.en:
Fuatai is a 23 year old woman  with 1 children. She has run a business to sell elei for 3 years. 

Fuatai has requested a loan to buy paint, paint brushes, materials, and an elei board. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. 

She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint, paint brushes, materials,and an elei board.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Niña Daffodil is 17 years old and is 1st of the four children in the family. Her mother Maribel a member of NWTF, supports the family through her tailoring business in the Philippines.

Niña Daffodil is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently on her 1st of this 4-year course.

Maribel is borrowing PHP 13000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Niña Daffodil for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Niña Daffodil plans to be gainfully employed so she could help to improve the quality of life of her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's first semester tuition fees for a B.Sc. in Business Administration

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 45 years old and married with four children, with one child still in school. Antonina works very hard to provide for her family.

Antonina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and other personal care products. Antonina has been in this business for 21 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman, 58 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelly has a buy and sell used cloth business in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used cloth to sell in the stall.

Nelly has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of used clothing to sell on her stall

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman with three children who works hard to support her family.

She sells used clothing and earns additional income from food vending. Raquel is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase more boxes of used clothing.

Raquel has sustained her business through 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita works hard to support her family by operating a fish vending business for 7 years.

Melita requested  9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

She earns additional income operating a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is 41 years old man and lives with his wife, two daughters and son in Ijevan city which is in Tavush region. More than 15 years Sevak with his wife engaged in pig breeding and aviculture on his farm. He has a one pig and 35 chickens. Sevak sells a meat, eggs and poultry which he produces with his wife in their farm. Sevak also engaged in fruit and vegetable wholesale trading, which he makes using his truck in Tavush region wholesale markets. He says that it’s not easy to survive and keep his family during this heavy economical situation but he is happy that his farming and trading business allows him to solve his family needs.

Sevak needs to buy a lot of fodder for his pigs and chickens and to buy 2 more piglets in order to enlarge his farming. So he hopes with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon support to achieve a good result and to rise up the income from his activities.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his pigs and chickens and to buy 2 more piglets

loans.name: Kenzhekul

texts.ru: Кенжекуль, 36 лет, в разводе, на иждивении - 4 детей школьников. У нее неоконченное высшее образование, с 2002 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У Кенжекуль в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, а также 4,0 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает люцерну. Кенжекуль известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и трудолюбивый человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 20,900 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжекуль обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, Кенжекуль мечтает купить телевизор для ее семьи.
texts.en: Kenzhekul is 36 years old, divorced, and her dependents are four school-age children. She has an incomplete secondary education. Since 2002 she has been farming for her main income. Kenzhekul has three cows and ten sheep, and she also has 4.0 hectares of irrigated land where she grows alfalfa. Kenzhekul is well known as a principled, honest, decent and hard-working person. Today she receives a monthly profit from her busienss of about 20,900 som (KGS), but these funds are insufficient for a decent life and for supporting the family. In order to develop her business further, Kenzhekul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) which she will use to buy some livestock. She plans to use the proceeds of the loan to develop her business, and Kenzhekul dreams of buying a television for her family.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Zuura

texts.ru: Зуура, 47 лет, не замужем, дочь в этом году пойдет в первый класс. У Зууры высшее образование, кандидат наук. В настоящее время она работает преподавателем в университете, получая заработную плату в размере 31,000 сом (KGS). Зуура с дочерью планируют переехать в собственный дом, который недавно приобрели, но в котором еще нет условий для проживания. Поэтому Зуура обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) для покупки обоев, кафеля, дверей и прочего для проведения ремонта. Доходы Зуура будет направлять на дальнейшее улучшение условий проживания.
texts.en: Zuura is 47 years old and single.  She has a daughter who will enter first grade this year.  Zuura has a PhD and currently works as a university professor, making a salary of approximately 31,000 som (KGS).  Zuura and her daughter are planning to move into their own house, which Zuura recently bought but which is not yet suitable for living.  For this reason, Zuura has turned to Bai Tushum Bank and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy wall-papers, tiles, doors and other necessary items to finish all renovations. Zuura will be using her income to further improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wallpapers, tiles, doors, etc... in order to finish her newly purchased house.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a married woman with eight children who works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business and earns additional income selling dry goods. Jacqueline is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional cloth, needles, zippers, thread, buttons, and other materials.

Jacqueline has sustained her business through 1 previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, needles, zippers, thread, buttons, and other materials.

loans.name: Navangkhai Group

texts.en:
Maivue’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Maivue and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Maivue and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years, filter users, like Maivue’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nokkokkhoomxiengxoom Group

texts.en:
Bounyong’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Bounyong and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Bounyong and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Bounyongw’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John was born and raised in Makueni, a county in Kenya, but later moved to Nairobi the capital city where he settled. He runs a retail shop business, cereals and owns residential property at the expansive Mukuru informal settlements. The area however has a few sanitation facilities which cannot be relied upon by the large population.
 
John learnt about the Fresh Life Initiative and was impressed by the standards of sanitation and the simplicity provided by the model.
He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet. The facility will be set up for his tenants with the aim of improving sanitation as well as adding value to his property. 

He plans to use the extra income to repay his loan and put up more structures in order to improve sanitation for the whole community.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life toilet to improve sanitation needs for his tenants

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Этого мужчину зовут Усмон. Он 50 летний житель района Хамадони. Он живет вместе с женой, детьми и невесткой. Эту большую семью Усмон кормит сам, за счет своей работы. Усмон занимается земледелием. В этом году он тоже готовится к посеву нового урожая. Для этого ему необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями и приступить к посеву. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Усмон просит ему помочь купить минеральные удобрения. Усмон верит, что его поддержат и заранее балгодари Вас за помощь.
texts.en: The name of this man is Usmon. He is a 50-year-old resident of the Hamadoni district. He lives together with his wife, children and daughter-in-law. Usmon provides for this large family by himself with his work. Usmon is involved in animal husbandry. This year he is also preparing to plant a new crop. To do this, he needs to cultivate the soil with mineral fertilizers and start to sow. Due to the lack of money, Usmon is requesting help to buy mineral fertilizers. Usmon believes that he will be supported and thanks you in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Shahbozjon

texts.ru: Шахбозчон самостоятельный молодой человек. Ему всего 21 год, но он многого добился. Он не женат, живет в доме родителей. Так как после окончания средней школы из-за финансовых проблем он не смог поступит в Университет, Шахбозчон начал работать таксистом. Ему помогли родители и дядя. Шахбозчон очень старательный юноша. Он хорошо общается с пассажирами, аккуратно вводит машину. Он зарабатывает и хочет помогать родителям, так как у них нет хорошего источника дохода. В данный момент его машина сломалось и нуждается в ремонте. Однако у Шахбозчона нет достаточных средств, чтобы отремонтировать машину. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Шахбозчон ждет поддержки с Вашей стороны!
texts.en: Shahbozjon is an independent young man.  Although he is only 21, he has already achieved a lot.  He is single and still lives with his parents.  He finished secondary school but was unable to attend university because of difficult financial circumstances.  Instead, he started to work as a taxi driver.  His parents and uncle initially helped him.  Shahbozjon is a very serious young man.  He relates well with his passengers and drives very carefully.  He makes his own money and wants to help his parents because they do not have a good source of income.  At the moment Shahbozjon's car is broken and needs to be fixed.  However, he doesn't have enough money to pay for these repairs.  For this reason he is taking a loan and awaiting your support!

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia lives in Ermera where she is a businesswoman. 

Elia is applying for a loan of 1,500 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a secondhand clothing shop. She started this business in 2010 with her own working capital of 500 USD. 

Elia earns a good income from selling her secondhand clothing because she operates in the center of the market. As well, many people like to buy from her since her items are unique and her prices are low, compared to new clothing. 

Elia also raises animals such as pigs, chickens, and dogs.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, women's short- and long-sleeved shirts, as well as other clothing to resell.

loans.name: Sobna Group

texts.en:
Pheng understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Pheng knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Pheng purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Pheng is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Namkang Group

texts.en:
Buapa is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

Buapa and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Buapa and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Buapa and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Buapa and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is requesting a loan of $ 1500.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as  water, cooking oils, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. Agusta started to open her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $ 800.00. 

She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She has a small kiosk, so she is taking this loan to add with her working capital, because she wants to run her business and make it bigger in future. She also cultivate animals like cows and pigs

loans.use: To buy water, cooking oils, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 32 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 5 años, y estudia la carrera de administración de empresas.
Él es buen padre, inteligente, emprendedor, independiente, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los desarrolla en la zona central
área que aglomera a la mayoría de entidades públicas y gubernamentales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Juan es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja en librería y con su hijo que ya va a comenzar la edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, alcantarillado y agua potable. Él estudia la carrera de administración de empresas; y se encuentra en 4 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta entender los problemas administrativos para encontrar la mejor solución conveniente para la empresa, su carácter es de servicio, “estudio para terminar mi carrera y trabajo en mi negocio propio…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios, él trabaja atendiendo su bazar librería, negocio que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar las cuotas de su universidad. Su sueño es ser profesional para crecer en la empresa en donde trabaja y desea realizar el pago de las cuotas de su carrera. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera, así poder terminarla y crecer en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is a 32-year old man. He is married and has a 5-year old son. He is studying business administration.

He is a good father, intelligent, entrepreneurial, independent, constant, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking. He studies in the central zone, an area where the majority of public and governmental organizations are clustered. The area has a cold and dry climate with a daytime temperature that ranges between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius (32 and 55 degrees Fahrenheit).

Juan has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature, and medium build. He mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish in public and for his studies.

He shares his life with his wife who works in a stationery shop, and with his son, who is about to start school. They live in their own house built from brick and cement, with an iron roof and a wood floor, that has electricity, running water, and plumbing.

He is studying business administration, and he is in the 4th year of his 5-year degree. He enjoys helping people, and he likes understanding business problems in order to find the best solution for the business. His character is one of service. "I am studying to finish my degree, and I work in my own business," he says.

In addition to studying, he also tends to his stationery shop, a business that is located in his home. The advantage of this is that the schedules don't conflict, and the disadvantage is the lack of money to pay his university fees.

His dream is to be a professional in order to grow in the business where he works, and he wants to pay the fees for his degree. This is the first round of loans with the institution in the 4 years he has been pursuing professional studies.

It is for these reasons that Juan is applying for a loan to pay the fees for his degree to be able to finish it and grow in his work.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his degree so that he can finish it and move forward in his work.

loans.name: Aysar

texts.en:
Aysar is a 24-year-old young man from small village near Ramallah City. He lives with his family in a small humble house. Aysar is working in a poultry farm in the village where he gets low income it barely cover his family expenses, he decided to open his own farm. 

Aysar took a USD loan from FATEN to buy poultry for his new private farm. After Aysar has taken the loan, it will achieve his dream and become has a fixed source of income also become economically independent.

Aysar appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy poultry for his new private farm and become economically independent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of her tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to launch her new clothing business

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
Cinderella works hard to support her family. She is married with 3 children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Cinderella has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more fish to resell in her food stall.

Cinderella has been in this business for 3 years now, though she also earns additional income from food vending. She would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell in her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a pub

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru: Раиса, 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Раиса занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад с покупки коровы и 3 поросят. Благодаря упорному труду Раисы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1,0 Га земли, где она выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Раиса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на обработку почвы и выращивания экологически-чистой продукции. Доходы от кредита Раиса планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Raisa is 60 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 2 children. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, Raisa is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 20 years ago with a purchase of a cow and 3 piglets. Thanks to Raisa's hard work, today her farm contains 1.0 hectare of land, where she grows clover. Her monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Raisa requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to cultivate the soil and grow organic products. Raisa plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and repairing her house.

loans.use: to cultivate the soil and grow organic products

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
NIM, 62, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has seven children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and sesame and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business for around thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 2.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides, to improve her earnings from $2 a day

loans.name: Siliala

texts.en:
Siliala is a 31 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She runs a business selling daily goods like sugar,flour,corned beef,etc in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. 

Siliala has requested a loan to buy canned foods, freezer goods, toiletries, soft drinks etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy canned foods,freezer goods,toiletries,soft drinks etc

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is a 25 year old unmarried woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows tomatoes,cabbages,beans etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Mele has requested a loan to wires,seeds,chemicals,knives,etc.. She has been a member of SBPD since June this year 2015. With her profits, Mele hopes to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy wires,seeds,chemicals,knives,etc. for her farming plantation

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Гулизор 49 летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Гулизор живет вместе матерью, сестренкой и племянником. К сожалению Гулизор инвалид. Она рожденная такая. По этой причине она не замужем. Но Гулизор добрая, умная, красивая женщина. Гулизор болеет, у нее серьезна проблема со здоровьями. Ей надо сделать операцию, чтобы восстановить здоровье. Гулизор еще молодая женщина, ее вся жизнь еще впереди. Но у нее нет такая сумма денег для операции, и Гулизор решила обратиться к Вам за кредитом. Она очень нуждается в помощи. Гулизор надеется на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите ее! Гулизор заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Gulizor is a 49-year-old resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is not married and does not have children. Gulizor lives with her mother, sister and nephew. Unfortunately, Gulizor is disabled. She was born this way. This is also why she not married, but Gulizor is a kind, smart and beautiful woman. Gulizor is ill and has serious problems with her health. She has to have a surgery to repair her health. Gulizor is still a young woman, and her whole life is ahead of her, but she does not have the needed amount of money for the surgery, and this is why Gulizor decided to come to You for the loan. She really needs help. Gulizor relies on Your support. Please support her! Gulizor expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to have surgery and restore her health

loans.name: Buntha

texts.en:
Buntha, 55, lives in Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia and has five children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and sells his agricultural product to local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, he is able to make an income of 2.00 USD a day.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides for his rice fields and improve his small income

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
KARINA TIENE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD, MADRE SOLTERA, VIVE CON SU PADRE E HIJO, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI, EN LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ. SU COMUNIDAD DE DEDICA BÁSICAMENTE A LA AGRICULTURA, COMERCIO Y GANADERÍA.

KARINA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 3 AÑOS EN EL NEGOCIO,CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES, EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA COMO PERFUMES, COLLARES, CREMAS, ENTRE OTROS, PARA AMPLIAR SU STOCK, DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO,OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Karina is 36 years old and a single mother. She lives with her father and son in a house of their own in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, north coast of Peru. Her community works basically in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Karina has worked in the occupation of beauty products sales for more than 3 years in the business, with very good personal and work references, in her own home. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as perfumes, necklaces, creams, among others, to expand her stock and this way, make her business grow, earn more income, and be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (perfumes, necklaces, etc.) to expand her business stock.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth de 51 años, reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de sus dos hijos, esta soñadora mujer decidió emprender un proyecto desde su hogar y empezó a explorar las oportunidades que al interior de su comunidad existían, fue entonces que decidió a organizar una miscelánea para ofrecer a los habitantes del sector donde reside cosméticos, papelería, útiles escolares, detalles de ocasión, perfumes y demás. Yaneth, se encuentra satisfecha por sus logros, muestra mucho entusiasmo y energía, tiene una visión clara de su negocio y trabaja para cumplir sus objetivos. Actualmente está solicitando a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su primer credikiva, el cual invertirá en la adquisición de una nueva vitrina para ampliar su negocio y la compra de un mayor surtido en cosméticos, ropa, calzado y detalles que le permitan al término del año triplicar las ventas actuales y la generación de ingresos que a largo plazo le permitan comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 51 years old, lives in a neighborhood in Barranquilla with her two children. She's a dreamer who decided decided to launch a project from home and began to explore the opportunities which existed within her community. It was then that she decided to open a corner shop to offer cosmetics, school supplies, paper goods, gifts, perfumes, and more to the residents of the area. Yaneth is very satisfied with her achievements. She demonstrates great energy and enthusiasm, and has a clear vision for her business and the work necessary to accomplish her objectives. 

She is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to acquire a new display case to expand her business and to purchase a larger variety of cosmetics, clothing, footwear, and gifts. This will allow her to triple her current sales by the end of the year, and the long-term income generation will allow her to purchase her own home.

loans.use: to acquire a new display case to expand her business and to purchase more cosmetics, clothing, footwear, and gifts.

loans.name: Hanebie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Hanebie works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Hanebie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business for her pottery making business.

Hanebie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her pottery business

loans.name: Renacer De Ayarmaca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal RENACER DE AYARMACA,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, distrito de Chinchero y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Gloria tiene 40 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Renacer de Ayarmaca. The bank is located in the province of Urubamba, Chincero district, in the department of Cusco. Gloria is 40 years old and married with two children. She spends her days working in a grocery store. She has been in the business for a long time, and it has been going well thanks to the effort which she puts forth every day. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can support her family.

She requests this loan to purchase rice, sugar, and more. The members feel grateful for the loans they've been given and promise to make their payments. The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to a meeting due to work obligations.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: Martha tiene 24 años de edad tiene dos hijos vive en Guaranda provincia de bolivar, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agricolas y para alimentos para sus animales, gracias al crédito ella podra mejorar en su economia, realiza las compras cada semana en Guaranda, su sueño esa conseguir un trabajo estable, en su tiempo librer le gusta pasar en familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 24 years old and has two children. She lives in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar. 
She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and food for her animals. Thanks to the loan she will be able to improve her economic situation, and make her purchases every week in Guaranda. 
Her dream is to be able to obtain a stable job. In her free time she likes spending time with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Diana Alexandra

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer ecuatoriana de 22 años de edad que nación en la parroquia rural, Pastocalle de la ciudad de Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi. Esta zona rural se caracteriza por tener un clima frío en donde la gente se dedica a la agricultura y elaboración de escobas. Por cuestiones económicas tan solo pudo culminar sus estudios primarios sin embargo sus padres le ensañaron a cultivar para de esta manera pueda sustentar a su familia. Es madre soltera y tiene una preciosa hija por quien lucha cada día por sacarle adelante y darle un estilo de vida favorable.
Diana usara el crédito solicitado para incrementar su negocio y la producción de la siembra de cebolla blanca para de esta manera mejorar el estilo de vida de su hija. Diana agradece a KIVA y a Fundación Alternativa por hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Diana is a 22 year-old woman from the rural parish of Pastocalle, in the city of Latacunga, in the Cotopaxi province.  This rural area has a cold climate and the people there work in agriculture and broom-making.  Due to financial reasons, she was only able to complete her primary education.  Her parents taught her how to farm and in this way provide for her family.

She is a single mother, and has a precious daughter who she fights for every day, in order to get her ahead and give her a good quality of life.  Diana will use the loan to expand her business and the production of the white onion crop she grows.  This will help her to improve her daughter's quality of life.  Diana is grateful to Kiva and to Fundación Alternativa for realizing her dreams.

loans.use: to increase her onion crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of vegetables like tomato, onion, cabbage, etc. to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es: María de 40 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad a los que apoya con sus estudios. El cantón donde vive María se encuentra muy alejado de la ciudad, por lo que el pequeño molino de nixtamal con el que cuenta María es el único más cercano, contando gracias a ello y su amabilidad con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus servicios. María desea reparar el servicio sanitario de su vivienda, ya que este presenta una fuga de malos olores que esta ocasionando enfermedades a su familia y vecinos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para reparar el servicio sanitario y mantener la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working, 40-year-old woman who lives with her life partner and their two children aged 11 and 4, who they help with their studies. 

The community where Mary lives is located far from the city, so the small nixtamal corn mill Mary runs is the only one in a large zone. Thanks to this and her kindness, she has a lot of clients who request her services. 

Mary wants to repair the sanitation system in her home because it is currently emitting noxious odors that are causing illness among her family and neighbors. She is thus applying for a FUSAI loan to buy cement, sand, and gravel to repair the sanitation system and maintain a healthy environment in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to repair the sanitation system and maintain a healthy environment in her home.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 49 years old, and she has 7 children. She is married, and one of their children is still in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to help raise her pigs.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosita would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to help raise her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis alfredo tiene 20 años de edad, conviviente , con un hijo a su cargo , vive en casa familiar; en el sector Nueva Esperanza, que pertenece al distrito de Oyotun, la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Luis Alfredo se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; hace 5 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en Activo fijo; compra de dos mochilas para fumigar; herramientas de labranza y otros gastos; esto le servira para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 20 years old, and lives with his partner and his child in the family home.  They live in the Nueva Esperanza sector, in the the Oyotun district, which is a rural area that pertains to the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú.  The people of this district work mostly in agriculture, livestock, and business.

Luis Alfredo has worked offering his services as a day laborer for five years.  His business is located in his home, and he is requesting a loan to invest in fixed assets such as two fumigation backpacks, tools for farming, and other costs.  This will allow him to have tools in better condition and give him a better appearance in order to offer better services.

loans.use: to buy two fumigation backpacks, farming tools, and cover other costs.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 46 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. For the past ten years she has fattened up and sold pigs in the Philippines to earn an income.

Daisy has taken out and successfully repaid ten prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF for her pig business. She has now applied for another loan, this for 10,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to build up her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Delia has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: María tiene 34 años de edad vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, habas y mellocos. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como son vacas. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comparar fertilizantes y una vaca para mejorar su ganado, comprara en Riobamba, el desafio al que se enfrenta es el clima, en su tiempo libre le gusta tejer.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and lives in Guaranda, in the Bolivar province of Ecuador. María works in farming growing potatoes and other root vegetables, and broad beans. María also makes a living breeding animals such as cows. 

María will use this loan to buy fertilisers and a cow in order to improve her herd of cattle. María will make her purchases in Riobamba. 

One challenge facing María is the climate. 

In her spare time, María likes to knit.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Richard Danilo

texts.es:
Richard es un joven Ecuatoriano, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, vive en un sector rural de la ciudad en casa de sus Padres, donde se caracteriza por su clima frio. Richard tiene 21 años de edad y es soltero. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres estudió hasta la secundaria. Tiene planes de emprender su negocio de ropa, lo que le permitirá mejorar su estilo de vida. 
Richard usará el crédito solicitado para la compra de ropa, esperando mejorar sus ingresos. Richard agradece a Kiva y Fundación Alternativa por ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Richard is a young Ecuadorean. He was born in Latacunga city, a cold place in Cotopaxi province. Richard now lives at his parents’ home, which is in a rural area. Richard is 21 years old and single. Thanks to his parents’ hard work, Richard was able to go to high school. Richards plans to start a clothing business, which will allow him to improve his lifestyle. 

Richard will use this loan to buy clothing and, he hopes, to increase his income. Richard is grateful to Kiva and Fundación Alternativa for helping him to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothes, allowing him to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Gulfiya

texts.ru: Гульфия, 57 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей - студентов. Образование-средне-специальное. С 2002 года занимается животноводством. Бизнес начала с 6,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день Гульфия успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, а в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 6 коров, 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Гульфии составляет 8,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Дети помогают вести домашнее хозяйство. На доходы от кредита Гульфия планирует увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Gulfiya is 57 years old, married and raising 2 children, both students. She has a specialized secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2002, having started this business with 6,000 som (KGS). Today, Gulfiya is a successful farmer on her small farm that contains 6 cows and 20 sheep. Gulfiya's monthly profit amounts to 8,800 som (KGS). Her children help her run the household. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock.  Gulfiya plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Dúo Unión Y Confianza Group

texts.es:
Dúo Unión y confianza
Doña Felisa es originaria del municipio de Tecpán, ella tiene 51 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos menores de edad que necesitan el cuidado de ella, 2 mujeres y un varón, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y a la venta de ropa en el mercado municipal de Tecpán.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijas doña Felisa sigue adelante con su negocio ya que entre ellas se están ayudando para salir adelante.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para la venta de comida, dicha actividad lo ha venido realizando desde hace varios años.
