Sandra is a 21-year-old young woman. She is a hardworking and determined single mother, who makes a living by selling merchandise out of her home. This provides her with the minimum income to support her son.

Due to an accident that she suffered months ago, she finds herself with little working capital, and she still is suffering from some physical issues. For this reason, she hopes to purchase more merchandise, such as blouses, jeans, and footwear. In this way, she will be able to return her business to normal.

Her dream is to continue working in order to provide her son a better future and pay for his education.

You can be part of this dream, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as blouses, jeans, and footwear

loans.name: Orfidio De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 60 años, el señor Orfidio, luego de quedarse sin empleo y no contar con la ayuda de un familiar, inicio a realizar trabajos de cerrajería en su propia casa, esto lo aprendió a través de su padre y con lo cual ha podido mantenerse el mismo.

El sueño de Orfidio es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Con el préstamo que solicito comprara hierro, pinturas, y variedad de herramientas, lo cual le permita mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar sus clientes.
 
Con su apoyo este sueño se puede cumplir.
texts.en:
At 60 years old, Orfidio, after becoming unemployed and without help from family, started a locksmith business in his own home. He learned this trade from his father and has been able to support himself from this business. 
Orfidio’s dream is to improve the condition of his home. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy iron, paints, and a variety of tools, which will allow him to improve his earnings and increase his customer base. With your help this dream can be fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy iron, paints, and a variety of tools, which will allow him to improve his earnings and increase his customer base.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new weights and equipment for her sons' gym club.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Julieta was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Dede, one of Ruma’s agents. Dede lives in Sukabumi, a village located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. Dede is happily married, and together with his wife, they have three children. As his main source of income, Dede owns and manages a small stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories.

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Dede's shop. This will allow Dede to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product called "Mapan", designed for lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Dede and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. As a Mapan agent, Dede is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Dede will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Dede believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices.

Dede is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to have additional working capital to facilitate the introduction of Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian un joven de 19 años, trabajador y humilde que desde niño se dedico a realizar trabajos de campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, y con lo que hoy en día él y su familia han logrado salir adelante.

Debido a la sequia sus cosechas se han visto afectadas, por este motivo Cristian solicita un préstamo el cual lo utilizara para la compra de insumos agrícolas como insecticidas, fertilizantes entre otros.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando, cultivar más variedad de producto y mejorar el estado de su vivienda.
Impacte la vida de este campesino y la de su familia, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Cristian is a 19-year-old young man, hardworking and humble who, since childhood, was devoted to carry out field work thanks to the teachings of his father and with which today he and his family have managed to get ahead.

Due to drought, his crops have been affected; for this reason, Cristian is requesting a loan which he will use for the purchase of agricultural inputs such as insecticides, fertilizers, among others.

His dream is to continue working, to grow more product variety, and to improve the state of his home. Impact the life of this farmer and that of his family;  make a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as insecticides, fertilizers, among others.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha una señora con 35 años de edad, madre de un menor, que por necesidad económica se dedico a vender mercancía desde su casa, y que gracias a esto ha logrado salir adelante.
Una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que siempre ha buscado los medios necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de hogar.

Su sueño es brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo y poder pagarle sus estudios.

Actualmente Martha tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de camisetas, jeans, calzado, entre otros.

Haga parte de este sueño, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Martha is a 35-year-old woman, mother to a young child, who out of economic need, devoted herself to selling merchandise from her home. Thanks to this, she has gotten out ahead. A hard working and enterprising woman, she has always sought the means necessary to cover the needs of her home. 
Her dream is to provide a better future for her son and be able to pay for his studies.Martha currently has some very good orders from her customers and because she does not have a large amount of capital, she seeks a loan to buy an assortment of shirts, jeans, shoes, among other items. 
Be a part of her dream, lend today.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of shirts, jeans, shoes, among other items.

loans.name: Jusie

texts.en:
Jusie, aged 38, is married and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. She operates an agricultural business in the Philippines in which she rears and fattens pigs, which she has been doing for the past year.

Jusie has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jusie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, aged 53, is married with two children. For the past two years, she has earned a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Gloria earns additional income from a general store.

She is now borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gloria is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is separated and works hard to support her family. For the past two years, she has had a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Elsie has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, aged 33, is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. 

Helen has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Zulfa, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children. She has been running two businesses, selling goods in a retail shop and a genge (grocery hut or stall) business for the past four years. Zulfa works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Zulfa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to start her genge business. Zulfa has successfully repaid her previous loan. She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for its support. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her genge. Zulfa dreams of buying a car. 

Zulfa will share this loan with her loan group "Pamba" which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock out-of-stock items in her genge (grocery hut or stall)

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús es una persona disciplinada amante al deporte y a los niños, el cariño y la empatía que siente por estos chicos lo llevo a realizar estudios para poder dar clases a los pequeños para que se desarrollen primero como personas y luego como futbolista, su club es un espacio donde ellos se divierten y se mantienen activos, trabaja solo con chicos, los cuales espera ver en un futuro como grandes deportistas como James Rodríguez.

Jesús para incentivar y mejorar la calidad de sus entrenamientos deportivos quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de implementos deportivos como balones, petos, mallas, petos, conos.
texts.en:
Jesús is a disciplined person, and a lover of sports and kids. The affection and empathy he feels for these guys led him to conduct studies in order to give classes to the young to develop first as individuals and later as football players. His club is a place where they have fun and stay active. Working only with children, he hopes to see them in the future as great athletes like James Rodríguez.

Jesús, in order to encourage and improve the quality of his sports training, wants to request a loan to purchase sports equipment such as balls, jerseys, other clothing, and cones.

loans.use: to purchase sports equipment such as balls, jerseys, other clothing, and cones.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro un hombre con 39 años de edad, con carácter y disposición para el trabajo, se capacito en todo lo relacionado con la electricidad.
Trabaja dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus  clientes tiene un buen negocio.

El sueño de este hombre es seguir trabajando para comprase una vivienda.

Con el fin de incrementar sus ganancias y aumentar sus clientes Álvaro Solicito un préstamo con el que comprara repuestos y demás herramientas  necesarias para su labor.

Sabe que de la mano de interactuar este sueño se podrá cumplir.
texts.en: Álvaro is 39 years old, with a great disposition for work and a good personality. He trained in everything related to electricity. He works based on the demand for service, and he knows that he has a good business thanks to his clients. His dream is to continue working to buy a house. With the purpose of increasing his earnings and his clients, Alvaro is asking for a loan to buy spare parts and other tools necessary for his work. He knows that by getting a hand from Interactuar,  he will be able to accomplish this dream.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and other tools necessary for his work.

loans.name: Maria Idalia

texts.es:
María, de 20 años de edad, es una joven que a su temprana edad es madre de un niño, él cual es su esperanza y su razón de vivir, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

María, se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y a cuidar a su pequeño hijo, mientras que su pareja se ocupa de mantener seguros los granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia. 

María, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para poder sembrar sus granos en esta temporada, es por eso que necesita este apoyo para empezar a preparar a tierra y que la cosecha sea muy buena.

María, sueña con salir de la pobreza y que sus condiciones de vida mejoren para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en: María is 20 years old. She is a young woman who at an early age had a child who is her hope and her reason to live. She is in a relationship and her partner works in agriculture. Maria handles the household chores and takes care of her small child, while her partner works keeping the basic grains safe to feed the family. Maria needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs to be able to plant her grains this season. This is why she needs the support to begin work preparing the soil so that the harvest is successful. Maria dreams of getting out of poverty and hopes to improve their quality of life for her child's well being.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs to plant her grains this season.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Un pequeño impulso es lo que necesita la señora María para sacar su negocio adelante, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que inicio con un pequeño capital y unas estanterías de madera, a pesar de que el negocio se ve tan humilde y falto de surtido ha sido el sustento de una familia conformada por ella y tres hijos, pero no quiere conformarse solo con pagar sus deudas, busca progresar, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de granos y abarrotes en cantidades, poblando cada estantería en su negocio.
Su sueño es comprar una vivienda propia y montar un supermercado
texts.en:
A small boost is what is necessary for María to take her business forward. She has a grocery store that started with a small capital and wooden shelves. Even though the business has been humble and lacking in variety, it has been the sustenance for her family, herself and her three children. However, she does not want to settle only for paying her debts and looks for progress. This is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of grains and groceries in quantity, filling every shelf in her business.

Her dream is to buy her own home and set up a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase assorted grains and groceries in quantity.

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ramona es una mujer de 46 años de edad que inicio un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar como necesidad económica, un día cualquier de enero del año 2003.

Es madre de 2 hijos, ha visto como la tienda ha mejorado cada aspecto de su vida, desde su salud, su bolsillo, su familia, puesto que mantenerse ocupada, trabajar y comprar cosas para su vivienda ha sido una bendición y la mejor decisión que ha tomado en su vida.

Empezó con bajo capital, ella es humilde y lo admite, los ingresos que obtiene los ha focalizado mucho en su familia y ahora mira su negocio y quiere darle un agradecimiento por tanta ayuda que le ha dado por ello solicita un préstamo para realizar una remodelación a su local, comprando cerámica, estanterías nuevas y surtido que afianzaran y mejoraran el aspecto de su negocio.
texts.en: Ramona is a 46 year old woman who started her small grocery store with basic need products due to her economic need in January 2003. She ha two children, and has witnessed how the store has improved every aspect of her life. From her health, her pocketbook, her family, by keeping busy, working, and being able to buy things for her house, it has been a blessing and it was the best decision she took in her life.She started with a small capital, she is humble and has focused most of her earnings on her family. Now she looks at her business and wants to thank it for all the help, thus she is asking for a loan to remodel her store, by buying tile, new shelves,  and supplies to strengthen and improve her store appearance.

loans.use: To remodel her shop by buying tile, new shelves, and supplies to strengthen and  improve her shop's appearance.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 24 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Genevieve has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Genevieve requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc., for her business.

Genevieve has been in this business for three years. In the future, Genevieve would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc., for her business

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 32 years old, married and an energetic woman living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a general store in which he sells shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well.  Some relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone that is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. He does not have a sufficient amount to open additional businesses. 

Therefore,Fozia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be able to open a new, additional business in his general store. He hopes that lenders will support him and that this loan will prove productive for his business, as well. 

He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system, and he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband has been running a general store for the past seven years; her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Fouzia's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes. 

Therefore, Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also will be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Ati

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Ati, one of Ruma’s agents. Ati lives in Sukabumi, a village located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. She is happily married, and together with her husband, they have one cute child.  

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Ati's shop. This will allow Ati to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product called "Mapan," designed for lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Ati, and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. 

As a Mapan agent, Ati is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts, as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Ati will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Ati believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices. 

Ati is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to have additional working capital to facilitate the introduction of Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tricycle repairs and the renewal of permits.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 45-year-old lady who is living with her spouse in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her family, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving an auto-rickshaw for many years; his income is insufficient to feed the entire family. He has to maintain the auto-rickshaw body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, ASMA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can replace the auto-rickshaw body and can fix the engine problem. 

She hopes that now her husband can smoothly drive the moto-rickshaw. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in fixing the rickshaw and replacing the rickshaw's body.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for expenses for his tricycle business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops to improve productivity.

loans.name: Ian Brylle

texts.en:
Ian Brylle has a printing business to support his family. He applied for a loan to purchase inks and bond paper for the printing business. 

He is now on his way to repaying the loan with his new profits.

loans.use: to purchase inks and bond paper for the printing business

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda has a live-in partner woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has two children who are in school.

Eda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Eda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 49-year-old woman, and a mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession; her husband sells vegetables, e.g., onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Tasleem's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore, Tasleem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Grace has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Grace has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is the responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband is responsible in fulfilling the needs for the entire family. 

Her husband needs maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not acceptable. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to pay for this maintenance. Therefore, Samina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Samina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. This will also allow him to provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. 

Samina also plans to save money with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Samina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to allow her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, peanuts, iodized salt, fruit, sugar, milk and pay for tricycle repair

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, who is 53 years old. She is married to Julieto, a warehouseman. They live in Butuan City, the capital city of Agusan Del Norte in Mindanao. 

Marilou runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store. Her income from this business goes up and down due to stiff competition within the area. Aside from this, many of her neighbors have the habit of paying later for those items they get. Sometimes it takes a few days or weeks before they pay. She is a kind-hearted person who cannot refuse her neighbors because she understands that there are times when it’s really hard to earn money. 

Because of this unstable income from her store, she decided to convert one room of her house into a room-for-rent to supplement their everyday expenses. As of now, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000, which she will use to buy raw materials for an additional room-for-rent. Part of it will be used to buy more supplies for her variety store. Hopefully, she can boost her income with this additional capital and slowly move forward towards her dream of putting up a 24-hour convenience store.  

Marilou meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for an additional room-for-rent and to buy more supplies for her variety store

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Estela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Estela has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger amount of flour and food supplies to make more pastries to earn better income

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 62 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria Olinder

texts.es:
A sus 64 años la señora María, se dedica a realizar trabajos de campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su esposo.
Esto le ha permitido tener un buen progreso, hoy en día tiene cultivos de café y su propósito es seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que su estado no es el mejor.

María solicito un préstamo en la Corporación interactuar con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas al por mayor como abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes entre otros.

Aporte al sueño de esta señora, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
64-year-old Maria makes a living by working in the field, thanks to what to husband has taught her.

This has enabled her to have good progress. She currently has coffee crops and her goal is to continue working to achieve her dream of improving her living conditions, since the state of her house is not the best.

Maria requested a loan from Interactuar, which she will use to buy agricultural supplies, such as compost, insecticides, and fertilizers.

Support this lady’s dream and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies wholesale, such as compost, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Jenny Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una estilista de 39 años de edad, una mujer con carácter y disposición para el trabajo, se capacito en todo lo relacionado con la belleza en una institución.

Esta ha logrado consolidar un negocio en su casa, una sala de belleza.
Tiene un futuro increíble y su idea es seguir progresando e invirtiendo en su negocio que tanta satisfacción y mejoras en la calidad de vida le ha entrgado. 

Alejandra quiere solicitar un préstamo, con el cual desea surtir su negocio de productos que usa en sus pacientes como lo son tratamientos, tinturas,  entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a 39-year-old stylist. She is a woman with the character and disposition for the job. She trained in everything related to beauty at an institution.

She has managed to set up a business in her house: a beauty salon.

She has an incredible future and her idea is to continue growing and investing in her business, which has brought her so much satisfaction and so much improvement to her quality of life.

Alejandra wants to request a loan, which she will use to stock her business with products she uses on her clients, such as treatments and dyes.

loans.use: to restock her business with products she uses on her clients, such as treatments and dyes

loans.name: Aideth Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Aideth es una madre cabeza de familia sorpréndete, con una fuerza física y de voluntad impresionante, es madre de 3 hijos y se dedica a la venta de pipetas de gas, las cuales increíblemente transporta al hombro.

Su sueño es generar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una carreta para transportar las pipetas de gas y evitar tanto esfuerzo físico que a la larga será perjudicial para su salud.
texts.en:
This is Aideth. She is a mother and the head of her family. She has three children. She makes a living by selling gas cylinders, which she transports on her shoulders with extraordinary willpower and physical energy.

Her dream is to give her family a better quality of life. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a wagon for transporting the gas cylinders so she can avoid so much physical exertion, which would be detrimental to her health in the long run.

loans.use: to buy a wagon for transporting gas cylinders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom at their home.

loans.name: Vardo

texts.en: Vardo is 66 years old. She is married and lives with her pensioner husband. The source of income for the family is only from agricultural activities. Vardo decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to start a trading business. With the received credit, Vardo will purchase a stock of used clothes and will resell them among her villagers at a good price. She will be able to increase the family income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to begin to trade used clothes.

loans.name: Maria Dolly

texts.es:
Dolly es señora con 56 años de edad, ante la ausencia de su esposo que falleció a su poco, inicio a trabajar alquilando  lavadoras, y con lo que hoy en día ha logrado salir  adelante y sostenerse.

Solicito un préstamo en la Corporación interactuar con el que desea comprar más lavadoras para prestar dicho servicio, con esto espera mejorar sus ganancias y aumentar sus clientes.

El sueño de Dolly es mejorar las condiciones de su casa, pues esta no se presta para se negocio, pero con la ayuda de interactuar sabe que lo lograra.
texts.en:
Dolly is a 56-year-old lady. Faced with the loss of her husband, who passed away a little while ago, she began to work by renting out washing machines. She has managed to support herself by doing this.

She requested a loan from Interactuar, which she will use to buy more washing machines so she can continue offering this service. She hopes to improve her profits and gain more clients by doing this.

Dolly’s dream is to improve the state of her house. She knows she can achieve her dream with the help of Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy more washing machines to rent out in order to increase her profits and gain more clients

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ethel requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Ethel has been in this business for 14 years now.

Ethel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Asep lives in Sukabumi, a village located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 miles) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. Asep is happily married, and he is currently becoming an agent for Ruma's latest service for lower communities called Mapan.

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Asep' shop. This will allow Asep to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product called "Mapan" designed for lower-income communities. 

Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Asep and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. As a Mapan agent, Asep is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Asep will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Asep believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

Asep is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital to facilitate the introduction of Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Maria Laura tiene 23 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años vive con sus padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado para engordarlos y venderlos en el mercado para que venda la carne, el sueño de ella es tener una casa propia y terreno para sembrar y obtener mayores ingresos, en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Laura is 23 years old and is a single mother of a 3 year old son. She lives with her parents in Guaranda in the Bolivar province. She makes a living buying and selling cattle.

She is asking for a loan to buy cattle to fatten them and sell them in the market for the meat. Her dream is to have her own house and land to plant and to obtain a better income. In her free time, she likes to spend time with family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Emily hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 15,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record.

loans.use: to pay for house renovation.

loans.name: Judis Paola

texts.es:
Judis es una mujer de 25 años de edad, madre de dos hijos, luchadora, trabajadora que inicio una venta de mercancía para mejorar los ingresos en su hogar.

Trabaja desde su hogar ya que tiene que cuidar a sus dos hijos de 3 y años.

Con el dinero que ha ganado ha reinvertido en el negocio, compro estanterías y mayor cantidad de surtido.

Judis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido en lociones, desodorantes, cosméticos, accesorios entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Judis is a 25-year-old woman. She is the mother of two children. She is determined and hard-working. She started selling merchandise in order to improve her household earnings.

She works from home as she has to look after her two young children.

She has used the money she has earned to reinvest in her business by buying shelves and more stock. 

Judis wants to request a loan so she can buy lotions, deodorants, cosmetics, accessories, and other products for her business.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, cosmetics, accessories and other products for her business

loans.name: Lifina

texts.en:
Lifina, 53, is a single mother of one child, living in Kasese Uganda. She has a depot of beverages, working 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. She has been in business since 2000 with an aim of boosting her family's welfare, though she is limited by insufficient capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more beer and soda to resell. Her business dream is to expand her business and own a big depot in her area.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas for selling.

loans.name: Goussi

texts.fr: Madame Goussi, femme de 50ans est mère de 06 enfants tous adultes.  Son conjoint est retraité. Elle revend depuis 1996 des condiments qu'elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle demande un crédit à WAGES. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Madame Goussi is 50 years old and has six adult children. Her husband is retired. Since 1996, she has been selling condiments that she buys in the Grand Market of Lomé. She is asking for a loan to strengthen her business. She would like to grow her business and take better care of herself.

loans.use: buy condiments.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit avec son mari pasteur et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Elle revend des produits de détails(charbons de bois, haricots, bois) à domicile depuis 2009. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle demande un crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer l'avenir de la famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa lives in Lomé with her husband, a pastor, and their three children. She has been selling products out of her home (charcoal, beans, wood) for retail prices since 2009. In order to better meet the needs of her clients, she is asking for a loan from WAGES so that she can buy goods. She would like to grow her business and secure her family's future.

loans.use: buy charcoal and beans.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 46 years old and lives in Ozamiz City. She is married and has seven children. Alma owns and operates a retail business in their local community for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 for land redemption. Alma hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for land redemption.

loans.name: Hector Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándoles una educación de buena calidad.
Es un hombre soltero que desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender ropa, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Jaime tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de camisetas, jeans, calzado, lociones entre otros.

Le dedica 4 horas diarias a su negocio.

Su sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerle a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Jaime is a hardworking person who, thanks to his daily efforts, has managed to get his son ahead by providing him with a good quality education. He is a single man who, a long time ago, started selling clothes. With a lot of effort, he has been able to surpass a lot of problems that he has encountered.

Now Jaime has some very good orders from his customers and since he does not have a lot of capital, he is looking for a loan to buy an assortment of shirts, jeans, footwear, and lotions, among other things.

He dedicates four hours a day to his business.

His dream is to get ahead with his business and be able to offer his son a good quality of life and better economic stability. He knows that with the help of Interactuar he will be able to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of shirts, jeans, footwear, and lotions, among other things

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store in the corner of her house. She has a few years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has gained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan to buy packs of rice, flour, soaps, pulses, salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 46-year-old lady. She is the mother of eight children. Her son owns a workshop in which he provides services to maintain motorbikes. He is professional in his techniques and can easily fix the bikes in no time. He has to use various types of tools for the repairs. A few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place, but due to the move some of the important and expensive tools have been misplaced.

Razia has requested a loan for her son so that he will be able to compensate for this loss. He will buy repairing tools, spare parts, tyres, brake shoes, etc. for his motorbike repair workshop.

She wants to provide a better education and living standard for her children. She is hopeful that her son will utilize this amount in a positive way and his monthly income will increase. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy repairing tools, spare parts, tyres, brake shoes, etc for her son's motorbike repair workshop.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
This is Hasmik, a teacher by profession who is also occupied in agriculture. 

She lives with her three grandchildren who attend local village school. Hasmik's husband, son and daughter-in-law live and work in the neighboring country. They left their motherland with the hope of supporting their family financially.
 
Hasmik herself runs a farm. She works at school as a teacher and because her job is part time, the other part of the day is devoted to agriculture. She keeps a livestock of cows, calves, piglets and four pigs. In the family yard, she also cultivates wheat, barley and potato so that her grandchildren can have appropriate living conditions.
 
By applying for this loan, Hasmik asks lenders to support her farming business. She will use the loan to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock.
 
Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Hasmik's  loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. Her husband is responsible in fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to undergo maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is unacceptable. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to complete the needed maintenance. 

Therefore, Robina has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Robina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. 

Robina also plans to save money with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Robina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 50, is married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in August 2014.

Alice is a maize, beans and vegetable farmer. She is grateful to HiH EA for developing her entrepreneurship spirit through training and mentorship. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. 

This will enable her farm to produce higher yields for her own consumption and allow her to sell the surplus produce to the local market. She hopes to use the income to support her family's needs such as food and education for her children.

Alice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to boost crop yield.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 38 years old and single. Mildred owns and operates a retail business of basic commodities. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 36,000 PHP a month. Aside from her sari-sari store business, she also owns coco land that gives her additional income. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her business such as canned goods, soy sauce and other commodities

loans.name: Jose Casimiro

texts.es:
A sus 60 años el señor Casimiro, luego de quedarse sin empleo hace 2 años, inicio a trabajar vendiendo comida desde su casa, un medio por el cual ha logrado sacar a delante a su familia conformada por dos hijas y su esposa.

Casimiro un hombre trabajador y humilde desea ampliar sus horizontes y darle trabajo a las personas más necesitadas, por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como alimentos y desechables.

Su sueño es poder brindarles a sus hijas un mejor futuro y pagarles la educación.
Haga parte de este sueño, preste hoy.
texts.en:
After losing his job two years ago, 60-year-old Casimiro started a food business from home which has allowed him to support his family of two daughters and a wife.

Casimiro is a hard-working, humble man who wants to broaden his horizons and give employment to people in need.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy food and disposable supplies.

His dream is to give his daughters a better future and be able to pay for their education.

Be a part of his dream today by making a loan!

loans.use: To buy food and disposable supplies.

loans.name: Jimema

texts.en:
Jimema is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jimema is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jimema has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jimema has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jimema would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Marleny Yamileth

texts.es:
Marleny, de 31 años de edad, creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la venta de ropa y zapatos y se movilizaban a los diferentes caseríos de su cantón para distribuir sus productos, su familia está formada por su esposo y sus hijos.  

Marleny, tiene 5 años de experiencia en la venta de ropa y zapatos, todo lo aprendió gracias a sus padres; motivada por las ganancias que le generaba la venta de ropa, continuo trabajando para dar a su familia lo necesario y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela.

El dinero del préstamo será para fortalecer más su negocio comprando ropa y calzado para la venta, de esta forma ella podrá tener mejores ganancias y podrá continuar pagando la educación de sus hijos. 

Las metas que tiene Marleny son, tener un local en el pueblo donde pueda establecer una venta de ropa y comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladar su mercadería a su casa y a los diferentes lugares donde ella vende.
texts.en:
Marleny, 31, was raised by parents who sold clothing and shoes, moving around in different rural communities distributing their products.  She lives with her husband and children.

Marleny has five years' experience selling clothing and shoes, having learned the trade from her parents.  Encouraged by the profit she could earn selling clothing, she kept up the work to support her family and send her children to school. 

The money from the loan will be used to strengthen her business by buying clothing and shoes to sell.  This will allow her to earn more income and continue paying for her children's education.

Marleny's goals are to have her own clothing shop in the village and to buy a vehicle to transport goods to her house and other areas where she sells.

loans.use: To strengthen her business by buying clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan has a banana farm in Tangub. This is his primary source of income for his family. Since Juan cannot extend his manual labor to plant bananas, he acquires the services of his neighborhood to do the planting. Recently, he needed money to pay for planting costs, which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Juan wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor to plant bananas.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 24 years old and married with two children and two dependents, all attending school and living in Kasese, Uganda. Innocent sells crude salt and earns his side income from salt pans. He has been in this business since 2008 and has hopes of having a better life in the future. Despite his dream, he is faced with poor climatic conditions like heavy rainfall, which limit his salt business. He is a hardworking man who has asked for a loan to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is a hardworking mother from Aloran. She is 53 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Rizalina has signed up for membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Rizalina hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production).

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Rubén trabaja como carpintero en un negocio que formo hace algunos años atrás, su actividad le permite generar los recursos para alimentar a su familia conformada por dos hijos y su pareja, la falta de capital ha sido su principal problema para crecer, tiene buenos proyectos, la experiencia, la herramienta para trabajar pero le hace falta la materia prima para procesar.

Por tal motivo Rubén quiere solicitar un préstamo la razón es que busca comprar materia como madera. Grapas, telas, espumas, para la fabricación de muebles para sala.

Este préstamo será un impulso gigante, que le permitirá fabricar los diseños diferentes a todo lo visto en el mercado que tiene en la cabeza.
texts.en:
Ruben works as a carpenter in a business he started some years ago.  Through his work he earns an income to feed his family consisting of two children and his partner.  The lack of capital has been the main problem in expanding.  He has good projects, experience and the tools to work with but not the raw materials he needs for manufacture.

Therefore Ruben is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wood, staples, fabric and foam rubber to make living room furniture.

The loan will be a huge boost that will allow him to produce the styles he has in mind which are different from all those he has seen in the market.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wood, staples, fabric and foam rubber to make living room furniture.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia una señora con 29 años de edad, madre de una hija de 14 años, luchadora y guerrera que día a día busca los recursos por medio de un choche de bebé que adecuo para la venta de snacks y café.

Su trabajo como vendedora ambulante no esta tan fácil, la competencia y la seguridad le impiden mucho, pero dice que no se vence y quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de pagarle la educación a su hija y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Claudio solicito un préstamo el cual lo utilizara para surtir su coche de vasos desechable, snacks y otros.

Aporte a este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Claudia, 29, is the mother of a 14-year-old daughter.  She is a determined, hard-working person who seeks to earn a daily living by using a baby stroller as a snack and coffee cart.

Her work as a street vendor is not easy and competition and lack of safety get in her way.  But she says she does not give up and wants to continue working to pay for her daughter's education and improve the living conditions of her home.

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy a variety of goods including disposable cups, snacks and other items for her cart.

Please contribute to her dream by making a loan.

loans.use: To buy disposable cups, snacks and other items for her food cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her project by buying a new sewing machine and thread.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo un hombre con 43 año de edad, con dos hijas menores, trabajador y emprendedor logro consolidar un negocio de confecciones  a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo trabajando con varios amigos, labora de lunes a sábado 9 horas diarias.

Con el propósito de aumentar sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas Pablo solicito un préstamo el cual lo utilizara para la compra de insumos como telas de alta costura y maquinas.

Quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de comprarse una casa propia.
Aporte a este sueño, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Pablo, 43, has two minor daughters.  He is a hard-worker and entrepreneur who has been able to consolidate his sewing business and own clothing label thanks to the experience he received through several friends.  He works Monday through Saturday, nine hours a day.

In an effort to attract more customers and improve sales, Pablo is requesting a loan to buy high fashion fabrics and machines.

He wants to continue striving toward his goal of buying his own house.

Please contribute to his dream today through your loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as high fashion fabrics and machines.

loans.name: Zaira Yadira

texts.es: Zaira es una joven de 25 años de edad que vive junto a sus dos hermanos de 19 y 27 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 14 años. Zaira se dedica desde hace 2 años a atender a los clientes que visitan su tienda de productos básicos la cual instalo en su vivienda y le permite ganarse la vida. Zaira desea que su tienda cuente con la mayor cantidad de productos posible para de esta manera cumplir con lo que demandan sus clientes en productos, por ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: champú, detergente, golosinas, arroz, azúcar, pan dulce, chocolate para hervir, etc.
texts.en:
Zaira is 25 years old and has been living with her two siblings – ages 27 and 19 years old – in a privately-owned house for 14 years. 

For two years, Zaira has worked serving customers who come to her general store, which she opened in her house and which allows her to earn a living.

Zaira wants her shop to have more products, including the products that her customers request. She is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy shampoo, detergent, sweets, rice, sugar, sweet bread, hot chocolate and more.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergent, sweets, rice, sugar, sweet bread, hot chocolate and more.

loans.name: Jose Jair

texts.es:
José un señor con 55 años de edad, junto con su esposa trabaja en una miscelánea que iniciaron hace poco tiempo en su casa, con esto han logrado salir adelante y cubrir las necesidades básicas que su hogar amerita.

En el negocio las ventas no son las mejores ya que la falta de insumos no ayuda mucho, por esto el señor José solicita un préstamo con el cual surtirá su miscelánea de productos para la belleza, de aseo y de la canasta familiar.

Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que debido a las fuertes lluvias se ha ido deteriorando.
Usted puede hacer parte de este sueño, haga aun prestamo.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and works with his wife in a general store that the couple opened in their home a short while ago. The shop has allowed the couple to move forward and pay basic necessities in their home.

Sales are not great at José’s business, however, as the couple does not have enough stock. José is therefore applying for a loan in order to stock up the shop with beauty products, cleaning supplies, and staple goods.

José’s dream is to improve living conditions at his home as the building has deteriorated over time owing to heavy rains.

You can be a part of this dream if you provide a loan.

loans.use: to stock up his shop with beauty products, cleaning supplies, and staple goods.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco un señor con 55 años, soltero y sin hijos, dedicado a trabajar en un papelería heredada por la familia, con esto ha logrado encontrar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento, pero por motivos de competencias en el sector donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio sus ganancias no son tan buenas.

Con el préstamo que solicito el abastecerá su negocio de cuadernos, libros, marcadores, pegantes entre otros, con el fin de mejorar las ventas y ser más competitivo en el mercado.

Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues su estado no es el mejor.
Aporta a este sueño, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 55 year old man who is single and does not have children. He earns a living working in a stationary shop inherited through the family. With this he has managed to find the necessary resources for its upkeep. However due to the competition in the area where his business is, his earnings are not so good.

With the loan he is asking for he will stock up his business with notebooks, books, bookmarks, glue sticks, among other things, in order to improve his sales and be more competitive in the market.

His dream is to improve the conditions of his home, as it is not in the best state.
Contribute to this dream, lend today.

loans.use: to stock up his business with notebooks, books, bookmarks, glue sticks, among other things, in order to improve his sales and be more competitive in the market.

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en:
Voskehat is a farmer. She runs a small but sustainable farm which is able to provide her sustainable monthly income for living. Voskehat lives alone, as her two sons live and work as migrant workers in neighbouring country. 
She has applied for this loan to purchase three cows and forage for the livestock. This will help her farming business to grow further and bring income to Voskehat. 
Because the region where her village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Voskehat's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.
This hardworking woman hopes to receive Kiva lenders' support. She has a dream of developing her farm so her two sons will be able to come back home and live with her, in their motherland.

loans.use: to pay for three calves and forage for her livestock.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 35 años de edad, es agricultor de profesión, está casado y su esposa es muy humilde se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y tienen 2 hijos. 

Luis, se dedica a la agricultura desde los 10 años de edad, ya que su padre le enseño a trabajar muy bien este oficio y por ello lo desempeña muy bien gracias al apoyo de sus esposa, que está siempre a su lado ayudando con todo lo que puede para mejorar su condiciones y calidad de vida.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos, porque es tiempo de preparar la tierra y si no lo hace en este mes su cosecha será muy débil. 

Luis, desea que su cosecha sea muy buena, para obtener buenas ganancias y también asegurar la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 35 years old. He is a farmer by profession, he is married and his wife is very modest and is dedicated to the household tasks. They have two children.

Luis has worked in farming since he was 10 years old as his father taught him to do this type of job well and due to this he does it very well thanks to the support of his wife who is always at his side helping him with whatever she can to improve his conditions and quality of life.

Luis needs a loan to buy farming supplies to sew basic grains as it is the time to prepare the ground and if he does not do it this month his harvest will be very weak.

Luis hopes that his harvest will be good, to gain better income and also to ensure food for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Milena, una señora con 38 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos con 2 y 17 años, dedicada a la venta de mercancía, medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos.

Su sueño es comprar una vivienda y ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.

Solicito un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su negocio de blusas, camisetas, jeans y bolsos

Aporta al sueño de Milena, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Milena is a 38 year old women, is single and is a mother to two children who are 2 and 17 years old. She earns a living selling merchandise through which she has managed to get her family ahead in life.

Her dream is to buy a home and to offer her children a better future.

She is asking for a loan with which to stock up her business with blouses, tops, jeans and bags.

Contribute to the dream of Milena, make a loan.

loans.use: to stock up her business with blouses, tops, jeans and bags.

loans.name: Dumar Eudifas

texts.es:
Eudifas un hombre con 33 años de edad, trabajador, humilde y responsable dedicado a trabajar en un taller de mecánica en su casa, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su familia conformada por una hija menor y su actual pareja.
 
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para pagarle la educación a su hija, pues se preocupa mucho por su bienestar y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Eudifas solicito un préstamo con el cual comprara un compresor y demás herramientas que sean de su utilidad, con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas.

Con su aporte este hombre podrá seguir su sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Eudifas is a 33 year old man who is hard working, modest and responsible. He earns a living working in a mechanics workshop, through which he has managed to get his family ahead in life. His family is made up of a young daughter and his current partner.

His dream is to continue working to pay for the education of his daughter as he worries a lot about her wellbeing, and also to improve the conditions of his home.

He is asking for a loan to buy a compressor and other useful tools, with this he hopes to increase his number of customers and improve his sales.

With your help this man will be able to follow his dream, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and other useful tools as he hopes to increase his number of customers and improve his sales.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 35-year-old woman. She lives with her four children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile phone shop for the past three years. He sells new mobiles and mobile accessories, such as chargers, batteries, hands-frees, and Bluetooth devices. He has an even temperament, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. 

Shehnaz has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy more mobiles and accessories to increase his business and provide for the household.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is a member of PMPC for how many years. Recently, she loaned an amount of Php 33,000.00 for her medication. Saturnina is thankful for the support given.

loans.use: For needed medication

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is a microfinance member of PMPC. She supports her family with a meagre income of PHP 5,000 per month. Recently, Celestina availed a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to improve her family's living conditions

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is 47 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Joji has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. Joji requested a PHP 28000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon like lipsticks, bags, shoes, body sprays, etc. to sell.

Joji has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Joji would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon like lipsticks, bags, shoes, body sprays, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a businesswoman from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 58 years old, married and has been in  in retailing business for over ten years. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Nelia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she applied a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase stocks for her sari-sari store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Nelia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for sari-sari store such as detergents, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y luchadora de 49 años de edad la cual desempeño el papel de padre y madre, criando y alimentando sus hijos solo con la ayuda de su negocio de papelería y venta de cosméticos que con esfuerzo, largas jornadas laborales constituyo y mantuvo a lo largo del tiempo.

Ahora ella tiene un local comercial, con buen surtido y variado para todo tipo de personas, poco a poco van surgiendo reparaciones y modificaciones que tiene que hacer y conforme gana ingresos y paga deudas las va realizando.

Ahora que María tiene sus deudas al día quiere solicitar un préstamo para organizar el piso del local, poniendo cerámica y cumpliendo a cabalidad las normas de sanidad, pintara el local y si le queda dinero comprara surtido y comprara publicidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a responsible, hard-working and striving woman. She is 49 years old and performs the roles of father and mother by raising and supporting her children on her own, with the help of her business of a stationery and cosmetics store, which she managed to set up and maintain over time with strength and long working days.

Now, she has a business store with a great range of products and assortment for every type of person. Bit by bit, she has to carry out repairs and modifications in order to make an income and to be able to pay her bills.

Because she has to pay her daily bills, she now wants to request a loan to outfit her store and put tiles on to perfectly comply with health standards. She will paint her store, and, in case there will be money left, purchase more stock and buy advertisement.

loans.use: to outfit her store and put tiles on to comply with health standards.

loans.name: Bebelinda

texts.en:
Bebelinda has mastered her hog raising business in Oroquieta. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. Just as how she takes care her hog raising business and so with her membership with PMPC. 

She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 15,000 will help her build a concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens for better environmental protection

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich, a factory worker, lives with her farmer husband and a son in Taing Khlai Village. Beside her salary and her husband's earning, Pich's husband earns more money one selling charcoal. Working day and night, Pich and husband's living condition becomes better and better from a small cottage to a nice house. 
While improving their house, they want to improve their family's energy source too. Pich's husband has to go to charge battery almost everyday, which wastes time and also money a lot. Therefore, Pich decided to apply for Kiva loan to buy home solar system. She believes home solar system can help them save money and time and also for her only son's future education condition.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Taing Khlai Village, Svay Chirj commune, Samaki Me

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Marina una señora con 58 años, casa y sin hijos, trabaja en un almacén de calzado ubicado en Barbosa.

Su sueño es comprar una vivienda.

Quiere ampliar el negocio y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de zapatos con lo que podrá mejorar sus ventas, aumentar clientes y generar más ingresos.

Impacte la vida de Marina con un préstamo.
texts.en: Marina is 58 years old, and married without children. She works in a shoe warehouse located in Barbosa. Her dream is to own a home. She wants to grow the business and be able to offer work to the people most in need. For this reason she is requesting a loan for the purchase of shoes with which she will be able to improve her sales, increase her customer base, and generate greater earnings. Please help impact the life of Marina with a loan.

loans.use: Purchase shoes so that she can improve her sales.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is caring mother of three kids, and she is also caring wife of her ailing husband. She is very patient, as she has lost her fourth child two years ago. She was shocked by the death of her son to the point that she was not speaking and lost her social communication with people and neglected her home and her husband, then she revived and wanted to complete her road to achieve her dreams.

Sahar started her business 25 years ago at her home where she makes accessories and embroiders oriental dresses by hand to help her husband with the expenses of their household. Being so popular among her family members, neighbors and friends who like what she creates, Sahar decided to take a big step four years ago by starting her own dependent shop for accessories and handmade embroidery. 

After the rise in the standard of living and her husband needs for more treatments, she needs to expand and develop her work, therefore she applied for a loan to become enable to buy yarn, fabrics and tools to produce larger number of products to increase her sales and profit and also to do good promotion for her shop to attract more customers to her shop.

loans.use: to buy yarn, fabrics and tools to produce larger number of product to increase her sales and profit, and also to do good promotion

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, creció con sus padres, quienes fueron los responsable de apoyar e inculcar valores y  principios a sus hijos; su familia está formada por su esposo y sus dos hijas, las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

Ana, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la venta de ropa, estas actividades las aprendió de su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a la crianza de animales domésticos, todo eso le sirvió para conseguir los recursos necesarios para poder satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.

El dinero del crédito será para reparar las instalaciones donde crecen los cerdos, ya que al comenzar el invierno los animales se mojan por las lluvias, también comprara ropa para vender, de esta manera obtendrá un mejor beneficio económico para su familia.

Los sueños de Ana son, establecer una granja de cerdos más formal y construir instalaciones más adecuadas para el cuido de los cerdos y comprar ganado lechero.
texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old and went to school until third grade. She was raised by her parents, who were responsible to support and to impart values and principles to their children. Her family consists of her husband and her two daughters, who are both going to the town's school.

Ana is earning a living by raising pigs and selling clothes. She learned this from her grandmother, who spent all her life raising domestic animals. This was enough to make the income that is necessary to meet her family's basic needs.

The loan money will be used to repair the pigsties, because with the beginning of winter, the animals get wet from the rain. She will also buy clothes to sell. This way she will increase the financial income of her family.

Ana's dreams are to establish a more professional farm and build more appropriate facilities for raising pigs and buy dairy cattle.

loans.use: to repair the pigsties and to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Tiessiri Dongosso Group

texts.fr: Ladji  est un  membre du groupe  Tiessiri, il est celui qui tient la corne du bœuf  dans la photo, gentil avec les enfants. Il fait  l’embouche bovine, âgé de 40 ans, il habite au Mali  et père de 4 enfants, ses enfants sont âgés de 2an  à 15 ans dont(2) deux fréquentent  l’école, son épouse   est une ménagère. Il  exerce ce  métier il y a 10 ans, il s‘approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux marchés de sa localité. Il sollicite un prêt  subséquent    pour  accroitre ses activités d’embouche, il lui  servira à  l’auto suffisante de la famille: santé, école, nourriture. Ses activités peuvent lui apporté un revenus mensuel de 75000 FCFA. Il rêve   d’être automne et être utile dans la communauté.
texts.en: Ladji is a member of the Tiessiri Group who raises cows for a living. He is the man holding the cow by the horn in the photo. He is 40 years old, he lives in Mali and he is a father to four children, towards whom he is very kind. His children are aged between two and 15 years old; two of them are currently attending school. His wife is a housewife. Ladji has been doing this work for 10 years. He gets his livestock from local markets then resells them at these same markets. He is requesting this subsequent loan in order to grow his livestock rearing business, which will ensure his family's independence with regards to health costs, school fees and food. This activity can earn him a monthly revenue of 75,000 FCFA. His dream is to be able to live independently and to be useful to his community.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Madame Kayi est une dame de 37ans. Elle est mariée à un infirmier et maman d’02 enfants. Elle est tresseuse et revendeuse de mèches et pagnes. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert son atelier. Afin d’acheter des mèches et des pagnes, Kayi fait son second crédit à WAGES. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère avoir un grand atelier et assurer au mieux un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: Kayi is 37 years old and married to a male nurse. Together, they have two children. She earns a living through weaving fabrics and selling hair extensions and traditional pagne cloth. After receiving training, she opened her own workshop. In order to purchase hair extensions and sheets of pagne, Kayi took out a second loan with WAGES. As far as her future prospects are concerned, she hopes to run a large workshop and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Dienfa est l’homme qui a la corde attaché au bélier dans sa main.
Dienfa est un malien âgé de 47 ans il est alphabétisé en langue national bambara, marié père de 05 enfants dont  04 sont scolarisés et 01 non scolarisés  dont leurs âge est de 11 et 7ans.
Sa femme vent des condiments au foire local, il fait cette activité depuis 15 ans et il est dévouer  dans son élevage ; pour des problèmes de fonds, dans l’épanouissement de l’élevage de ses moutons il a fait recourt à L’IMF pour avoir plus de fond crédit  dans le but d’acheter plus de moutons et plus de béliers.Il s’approvisionne dans les milieux locaux et dans les villages voisins ;  Après avoir fini de les élevés il les revend aux comptants à un prix abordable et bénéfice tout en réalisant un bénéfice prévisionnel de  30000f par cycle.
