Il est souvent confronté à quelques obstacles tels que : la mévente et la chute des prix sur le marché. Il a un  rêve qui n’est que autre choses que l’aide apporte par l’IMF soit continuel  pour qu’il puisse être libre dans son métier pour qu’il puisse assurer les besoins de la famille sur le domaine de la santé, l’éducation  ,pour faire face à un lendemain meilleur.
texts.en: Dienfa is the man holding the ram by a rope in the photo. He is 47 years old and from Mali. He is literate in the national language, Bambara. Dienfa is a married father to five children; four of them are currently receiving an education. They are aged between seven and 11 years old. His wife sells food condiments at the local market. Dienfa has been working this trade for 15 years, to which he is devoted. In order to grow his sheep rearing activity, he turned towards IMF so he can access further funds to purchase more sheep and rams. He gets his livestock from local areas and neighbouring villages. After raising his animals, he resells them for cash at an affordable price. He earns a profit of around 30,000 FCFA per cycle. He is often faced with obstacles such as slumps in sales and falling market prices. Dienfa's only wish is that IMF continues to fund him so he can be free to run his business. This way, he will be able to meet his family's needs with regards to health costs and school fees. By doing this, they will be able to experience a better tomorrow.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and rams for resale

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 26 años de edad, sin carga familiar vive en una zona rural en el caserío Sabila del distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Edwin se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Edwin espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Edwin is 26 years old and has no dependents. He lives in a rural area of the village of Sabila, in the district of Cañaris, located in the province of Ferreñafe, region of Lambayeque, on the Northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, animal husbandry and commerce. Edwin works raising and selling beef cattle. His business is located in his own house. He has had 10 years of experience in the business and has good personal and work references in the area. He will use the requested loan to buy a larger amount of cattle, as well as balanced feed for it. With this, Edwin hopes to offer a better product to his customers, which will allow him to generate more income, and therefore increase his quality of life and that of his family. .

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of  beef cattle, as well as to buy balanced feed for it.

loans.name: Sorey Ximena

texts.es:
Ella es Sorey, una joven de 28 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia que acude a tu ayuda, la razón es que busca montar un negocio de confección a terceros, tiene la experiencia, las ganas, los clientes, la motivación pero necesita ese capital para comprar la maquina e insumos que necesita para arrancar.

Por tal motivo Sorey espera su colaboración, ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente las cuotas y con el préstamo comprara una máquina de dos agujas, maquina familiar e hilos.
texts.en:
Sorey is a 28 years old. She is a young mum and head of her family and is asking for your help. She is asking for your help because she is looking to set up a business sewing garments for third parties. She has the experience, the desire, the clients and the motivation but she needs money to buy the machines and supplies required to get her business started. 

For this reason, Sorey hopes she can count on your support. She is committed to paying her instalments back on time. She will use the loan to buy a double-needle sewing machine, a family sewing machine and thread.

loans.use: to buy a double-needle sewing machine, a family sewing machine and thread.

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián un hombre de 30 años, soltero y sin hijos, trabajador y humilde que día a día se busca los recursos para sostener a su familia, sus padres.

El sueño de Sebastián es continuar trabajando para comprar una vivienda

Con el préstamo solicitado el comprara una pulidora, un yunque, prensa, elementos de seguridad, marco para taladro y un soldador, con esto el espera aumentar sus clientes, mejorar sus trabajos y generar más ingresos.

Aporte a este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en: Sebastian is a 30 year old man. He is single and has no children. He is hardworking and humble, who day by day looks for resources to support his family, his parents. Sebastian's dream is to continue working to buy a house. With the requested loan, he will buy a polishing machine, an anvil, a press, safety features, a frame for the drill and a welding machine. With this he hopes to increase the number of customers, improve his work and generate more income. Give to this dream, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine, an anvil, a press, safety features, a frame for the drill and a welding machine.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. She tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Evangeline borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Evangeline looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Juliebee

texts.en:
Juliebee is 25 years old and married.

Juliebee works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from vegetable vending. 

Juliebee requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan.

Juliebee aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a conservative mother and asked her son to take her place in the photo. She is 43 years old and lives in Irbid with her husband and her five children.

Reham and her husband are working hard to ensure good educations and comfortable lives for their children. She always had a dream to complete her education, but she could not because of the financial situation for her family.
 
Her son is studying in university, majoring communication engineering in his third year, and she wants to see her son graduate from the university to be able to find good work to help his family with the household expenses.
 
Lately, Reham and her husband have been facing financial crises that prevent them from paying for their son's university fees. Therefore, Reham applied for an educational loan to help pay for his university fees and achieve his and her dreams.

loans.use: To help her son paying for his university fees.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Florence. She is 58 years old, married and a mother of four. All her children are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and beans farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to improve her budgeting and record keeping. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output. This will help her to cater for the family needs and in pay school fees.
 
Florence is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output for improved sales. This will help her to cater for the family needs and pay school fees.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат 50 летняя жительница славного городка Худжанд. Она жизнерадостная и миролюбивая женщина. Она живет вместе с сыном и невесткой. Рафоат работает дома. Она занимается шитьем и вышивкой платков. Рафоат уже год как работает в этом направлении. Рафоат набралась хорошего опыта и клиентов. Она решила расширить деятельность и купить больше тканей, чтобы выпустить больше платков. С такими намерениями она обратилась за финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en:
Rafoat is a 50-year-old woman from the famous city of Khujand. She is a cheerful and peaceful woman who lives with her son and his wife. She works at home as a seamstress sewing and embroidering scarves, a business she has had for one year.

Rafoat has good experience and clientele. She has decided to expand her business by purchasing more fabric, so she can make more scarves. For this reason she is seeking financial support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and expand her business

loans.name: Kry

texts.en:
Kry is a farmer living in Taing Khlai village with a wife and one child. 

Kry's wife works as a factory worker in a factory near their house to earn extra money for the family. Working hard day and night, Kry and his wife want to earn a lot of savings for their child to pursue higher education in the future. 

They want to find a way to save utility fees since their car battery is consuming a lot of time and money. After learning the benefit of a solar system from a neighbor who is using a solar system, Kry decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes a solar home system will provide reliable energy to use and also save money for his future goal.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Taing Khlai Village, Svay Chirj commune, Samaki Me

loans.name: Hernan Alonso

texts.es:
En el año 2002 con motivación, sueños, esperanza, ilusión, con optimismo inicio su negocio de mecánica el señor Hernán, guiado por su deseo de generar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, empezó como un empleado, adquirió experiencia y busco sus propios caminos, su jefe lo motivo mucho y hoy gracias a esa motivación tiene un negocio estable, con buenas proyecciones.

Al momento de iniciar el negocio, Hernán tenía un capital bajo, compro  maquinaria y herramienta de segunda mano y ya necesitan un cambio, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una prensa y herramienta de mano, la necesidad radica en que la calidad de su trabajo se está viendo afectada por el mal estado de sus herramientas.
texts.en:
In the year 2002 Hernán set up his business as a mechanic with motivation, dreams, hope, excitement and with optimism, guided by his desire to create a better quality of life for his family. He started out as an employee, gained experience and looked for a pathway of his own. His boss gave him a lot of encouragement and now thanks to this encouragement he has a stable business with good prospects. 

When he set up the business, Hernán had limited capital and bought machinery and tools second hand. Now they need replacing and this is why he wants to ask for a loan to buy a press and hand tools. The necessity is based on the fact that he sees the quality of his work is being affected by the poor condition of his tools.

loans.use: to buy a press and hand tools.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru:
Гулистон проживает в городе Душанбе. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Один сын и одна дочка. Она занимается продажи пирожки. Гулистон занимается  этой бизнесом более 15 лет. Она печет вкусные пирожки. Ей  в этой бизнесе нравится ежедневный доход. У Гулистон имеется точка, где она печет вкусные пирожки. Она с утра открывает свою торговую точку, и начинает продать свои жареные пирожки. Вот так Гулистон зарабатывает, и обеспечить семью. 
Гулистон хочет отремонтировать свой дом, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия семьи.  По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.  Ваш кредит поможет ей достичь своей цели.
texts.en:
Guliston lives in the city of Dushanbe.  She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children (one boy and one girl).  She sells pirozhki (baked or fried buns) and has been involved in this activity for more than 15 years.  She is a wonderful baker and what she enjoys the most about her business is the daily income that she makes. She owns a small outlet where she bakes her delicious pirozhki.  She opens her doors in the morning and then starts selling.  This is how Guliston makes a living and provides for her family.

Guliston wants to renovate her house and improve her family's living conditions.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  Your support will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio un hombre con 40 años de edad, casado y sin hijos, trabajador y humilde dedicado a realizar trabajos de campo desde hace poco tiempo con un horario de 8 horas diarias.

Su sueño es ahorrar dinero de su trabajo y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Con el préstamo solicitado el comprara insumos como cultivos de café y caña, con esto espera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias

Con su apoyo Antonio podrá seguir este sueño.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 40 year old man. He is married and has no children. He is hardworking and humble, and has done agricultural work for a short time, with a schedule of 8 hours a day.

His dream is to save money from his work and improve his living conditions. 

With the loan he has asked for, he will buy materials such as coffee and sugarcane crops. With this, he hopes to improve his sales and increase his profits.

With your support, Antonio can continue with his dream.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as coffee and sugarcane crops, hoping to improve sales and increase profits.

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 52 años de edad, una persona sonriente, emprendedora que no se queja por su situación económica por el contrario busca alternativas y maneras de potenciar su económica, en el momento se dedica a la venta de mercancía por catálogo, como lo es lociones, cremas de manos, productos capilares, productos de belleza y accesorios.

Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y tener una vida cómoda y placentera junto a su esposo.

Gladys quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de los productos anteriormente nombrados, buscando actualizar su catálogo para atraer un mayor número de clientes que signifiquen un aumento en ventas y teniendo el plus de ofrecer comodidades de pagos con un pequeño recargo de interés.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 52 year old woman. She is a smiling, entrepreneurial person who doesn't complain about her financial situation. To the contrary, she seeks alternatives and ways to improve her finances. Right now, she sells merchandise by catalog, such as lotions, hand creams, hair products, beauty products and accessories.

Her dream is to improve her living conditions and have a comfortable and pleasant life with her husband.  

Gladys wants to ask for a loan to buy a variety of the aforementioned products, seeking to update her catalog to attract a bigger number of customers, which will mean an increase in sales and having the plus of offering ease of payment with a small interest charge.

loans.use: to buy a variety of lotions, hand creams, hair products, beauty products and accessories.

loans.name: Ana Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucelly una señora con 47 años de edad, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos de 8, 13, 21 y 27 años, trabaja en un negocio propio vendiendo comida, con esto logra cubrir las necesidades básicas de hogar.

El sueño de Lucelly es seguir trabajando y comprar una vivienda.

Solicito un préstamo con el cual comprara insumos como queso, jamón, piña, harina, refrescos y utensilios. Con esto espera incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar sus ventas.

Haz parte de este sueño, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Lucelly is a 47 year old woman. She is single and the mother of four children, aged 8, 13, 21 and 27. She works at her own business selling food. With this, she is able to cover the basic household needs.

Lucelly's dream is to keep working and buy a house.

She has asked for a loan with which she will buy materials such as cheese, ham, pineapple, flour, beverages and utensils. With this, she hopes to increase her profit and improve her sales.

Be a part of this dream, make a loan today.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cheese, ham, pineapple, flour, beverages and utensils. With this, she hopes to increase her profits and improve her sales.

loans.name: 74-La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Elisabeth es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen 2 hijos de 17 y 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, amable, optimista, generosa, alegre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘Virgen del Luján’ situada al noreste de la ciudad, zona residencial y con crecimiento poblacional, con un gran movimiento comercial y en constante crecimiento de restaurantes, Canchas, Parques, es un lugar seguro, y de fácil acceso. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Elisabeth es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, ojos marrones, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, viste; enterizo animal print). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en la construcción y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia y trabaja y el menor está terminando la escuela. Viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a sus deseos de superación, esta vez ella lidera la banca de emprendimiento, sus compañeros desarrollan negocios como; tienda de barrio, comercio de huevo, venta de ropa de segunda mano, servicio de construcción, venta de lácteos, venta de empanadas y venta de cosméticos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo, arroz, papel, champú, aceite, especias, refrescos, etc., actividad que realiza en su tienda de barrio ubicada en su domicilio, “mis ventas son continuas porque no cuenta con competencia cercana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia directa, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio y continuar con las ventas. Su sueño es ser la tienda preferida del lugar, ella desea abastecer su tienda para continuar trabajando. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elisabeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda y continuar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 38-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and they have 2 children who are 17 and 19 years old. Her business is selling food and basic household essentials in her neighbourhood shop. She is a good mother who is kind, optimistic, generous, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her business in the ‘Virgen del Luján’ district situated in the northeast of the city. It is a residential area with a growing population, with a lot of business activity and constant growth and has restaurants, sports grounds and parks. It is a safe place and is easy to get to. It has a warm subtropical climate with a temperature which varies between 21 and 35 degrees Centigrade during the day.

Elisabeth is olive-skinned and has long chestnut-coloured hair which she wears tied back. She has brown eyes and is of short stature and a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks locally, and she speaks Spanish for everyday purposes and for running her business. In the photo she is the second from the left  in the animal print bodysuit.

She shares her life with her partner who works in construction, and with her sons. The older one is studying and working and the younger one is finishing primary school. They live in their own accommodation built of wood with a corrugated metal roof and brick floor. It has running water, electricity and sewerage.

Because of her desire to make progress, this time round she is leading the enterprise bank, to ask for a loan and improve the businesses. Her companions run businesses such as: a neighbourhood shop, selling eggs, selling second-hand clothing, building services, selling dairy products, selling empanadas and selling cosmetics. 

Elisabeth has a business selling food and basic household essentials such as bread, sugar, noodles, rice, paper, shampoo, oil, spices, soft drinks etc. She runs her business in her neighbourhood shop located in her home. She says: "My sales are constant because there is no competition locally". The advantage of her business is not having direct competition, while the disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock the business and continue with her sales. Her dream is to be the shop of choice in the local area. She wants to stock the shop so she can continue working. This is the fourth loan cycle with the institution in the year she has had the business.

This is why Elisabeth is asking for a loan, to buy food and basic household essentials to stock her shop and continue with the business.

loans.use: to buy food and basic household essentials to stock her shop and continue with the business.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es una madre cabeza de familia de 20 años de edad, una mujer perseverante, trabajadora, luchadora que se dedica a la venta de mercancía (calzado principalmente), gracias a este negocio se gana el sustento para el mantenimiento de ella y su hija.

Trabaja 6 días a la semana 8 horas por día, vende en almacenes y ambulantemente, es una persona que sabe rebuscarse el dinero para llevar el pan a la mesa.

Angélica en su negocio tiene oportunidades de crecer, no se ha tomado el atrevimiento de ir a otros negocios ya que no tiene las existencias suficientes para ofrecerles y tampoco el capital de trabajo para aumentar su inventario, este motivo lleva a angélica a solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de calzado, sandalias y chanclas crocs principalmente, dado que es el producto más vendido en la región
texts.en:
Angélica is a 20 year old mother and head of household. She is a persevering, hardworking woman who is a fighter. She sells merchandise (mostly shoes). Thanks to this business, she earns a living to support herself and her daughter.

She works 6 days a week for 8 hours a day. She sells to stores and as a street vendor. She is a person who knows how to earn money to bring home the daily bread. 

Angélica has opportunities to grow in her business. She hasn't gone to other businesses since she doesn't have enough to offer them or the working capital to increase her inventory. Because of this, Angélica has asked for a loan to buy inventory in shoes, sandals, and flip-flops, mainly Crocs, because this is the product that sells the most in the area.

loans.use: to buy inventory of shoes, sandals, and flip-flops, mainly Crocs.

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning for her family, as well. 

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Edelita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en:
Rosabella is 53 years old and married. She lives in Pagadian City. Rosabella has been a farmer. She earns 4,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. 

Rosabella is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Seline is a 61-year-old mother from the Kisumu area. She is married with four children.

She has an educational center where she offers different services, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has applied for her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to increase her working capital. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her dream is to be stable so as to support many children.

loans.use: to purchase school items like plastic seats and other furniture

loans.name: Anyi Paola

texts.es:
Anyi es una joven creativa, trabajadora y responsable que a sus 18 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía como lo es lociones, cremas de manos, cosméticos entre otros productos. Esta actividad le ha permitido soñar con poder estudiar en una universidad.

La meta de Anyi no solo se centra en estudiar su mayor sueño y propósito es trabajar para comprar una vivienda propia la cual quiere dársela a su madre y tenerla cerca el mayor tiempo que sea posible.

Estos buenos deseos y las ganas de crecer han llevado a Angi a solicitar un préstamo para aumentar el número de mercancía su pensando es tener una vitrina en el hogar la cual puede atender su madre y ella salir a vender productos ambulantemente con el claro de propósito de aumentar su utilidad.
texts.en:
Anyi is a young, creative, hardworking and responsible woman. At 18 years old, she sells merchandise such as lotions, hand creams, cosmetics and other products. This activity has allowed her to dream of going to college. 

Anyi's goal isn't just centered on going to school. Her biggest dream and goal is to work to buy her own home to give her mother and have her close as long as possible. 

These good wishes and desire to grow have led to Angi asking for a loan to increase the amount of merchandise she has. She is planning on having a display case in her home. Her mother can tend to it while she goes out to sell products as a street vendor, with the clear purpose of increasing profits.

loans.use: to buy a display case to show her products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kiboga in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells drinks in a depot. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy crates of soda and beer. It will help Florence to generate greater profits. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to have another depot. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a farmer from Oroquieta. She tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start coconut production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Janet feels she owes her good fortune to the PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she obtained a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Janet wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply coconut in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anabelma

texts.en: Anabelma learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it provides. Using capital from PMPC, she was able to start a farming business.  Anabelma borrowed another 50,000 PHP to pay for seedlings, compost, and seedbeds.  This loan will help boost her farming income.  Anabelma looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Rowena is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan of 5,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Anafelia

texts.en: Anafelia is a businesswoman who runs a retail store on her place. She is 40 years old and married. She has expertise in retailing. She runs a sari-sari store and earns an income that sufficiently supports her family. Anafelia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Anafelia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the ardent passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Dalameh

texts.en:
Dalamah is an ambitious lady who lives with her family in Irbid. She is 23 years old and studying in university, majoring in English language.

Dalamah is working besides getting her education because of the financial crisis that her family has been faced with; she wants to depend on herself, and to try to save money for her education.

She wants to complete her education and work in the same field with a better income to be able to help her parents with the household expenses. 

Now, she applied for an educational loan to help her pay for her university and achieve her dreams, and she needs your support.

loans.use: to help her pay for her university and achieve her dreams

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. Leonila is married and has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for 5 years now.

Leonila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred fully repaid her previous loan. She was able to buy more chicks that helped expand her poultry farming business. As a result, her income increased, and she was able to meet her family needs with ease. 

Now, she is borrowing to buy fertilizer that will help boost her maize, bean, and banana farming yields, putting her in a good position to meet market demand in the area. She looks forward to generating more income that will ensure there is food security in her household. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will help boost her maize, bean, and banana farming yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more kinds of vegetables

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La Señora Aida, vive en Cochabamba Provincia Chapare, tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil divorciada, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la actividad de comercio vende tazas de porcelana, platos de porcelana y ollas,  para la venta de su mercadería cuenta con un mercado consolidado en la feria, los días domingo y jueves, la señora requiere el crédito para compra de mercadería para su puesto de venta, de esta forma podrá mejorar sus ingresos e incrementará su patrimonio familiar con el fin de mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Aida lives in Cochabamba Province, Chapare.  She is 57 years old and divorced.  Financially, she is independent.  

She works as a merchant, selling porcelain cups, plates, and pots.  She has an established stall at the market on Sundays and Thursdays for selling her merchandise.  

She needs this loan to buy merchandise for her sales stall.  In this way she will be able to improve her income and increase her family legacy, with the goal of improving her quality of life to the benefit of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sales stand, and in this way, to improve her income and increase her family legacy

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 39 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children who are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonora has a business in the Philippines, where she buys and sells dried fish. She has been in this business for 6 years. Leonora requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liezel is 42 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Liezel has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Liezel has been in this business for 21 years. Liezel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her rope-making business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 48 años de edad, activa, compresiva, responsable y trabajadora que se dedica a la confección de línea propia de ropa , actividad con la que ha logrado salir adelante y soportar la embestida económica que genero la separación con su esposo quien daba buenos ingresos para el hogar.

Rosa gracias a sus habilidades ha hecho crecer su empresa y motivo del crecimiento es que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de blusas y camisas y parte del dinero será destinado al mantenimiento y reparación de su máquina de confección.

Para ella el préstamo será de vital importancia ya que podrá no solo contar con tela para la confección sino que también, tendrá sus máquinas a pleno para producir mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 48-year-old woman.  She is active, thorough, responsible, and hardworking.  She works sewing her own line of clothing.  Thanks to this job, she has managed to get ahead and withstand the financial onslaught created by a separation from her husband, who had brought a good income to their home.

Thanks to her skills, Rosa has made her business grow, and with the goal of additional growth she is asking for a loan to buy supplies for making blouses and shirts.  Part of the money will be used to maintain and repair her sewing machine.

The loan will be of vital importance to her because she will be able to not only have the fabric needed for sewing but she will also have her machines in working order to produce larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old and married with five children, all attending school. He is currently working with a Bundibugyo district local government in Uganda as a community development officer. He took up the job after training in the profession, and hopes to complete his house, but is challenged by the delayed and low salary payments. 

Richard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy building materials like sand, cement and timber to construct his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like sand, cement and timber for constructing his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

loans.name: Doa

texts.en:
Doa is a 22-year-old single lady from a village near Nablus city. Her father is a worker and he gets a very simple salary. Doa is a student in the university where she studies mathematics. She would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family. 

Doa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay for the new semester. By taking this loan, Doa will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Doa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for the new semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her first year university fees, majoring in Hospital Management

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a live-in partner woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lolita is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Lolita has a business selling fertilized duck embryos in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs to process and sell to her customers.

Lolita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to process and sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand to construct his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk supply for the family and others for more income gain.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Norma requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc. for her business.

Norma has been in this business for 31 years now.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 48 years old and married with 10 children. With five children currently in school, Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marina has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, eggs, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 23-year-old, single lady who lives in Irbid. Hala is studying for her bachelor's degree, majoring in public relations, and she wants to take her master's degree. She depends on herself and works in a restaurant; she is a very ambitious lady and a hard worker. 

Lately, her family faced a financial problem, and she gave them her saved money for the university; therefore, she applied for an educational loan to cover her upcoming semester fees.

Hala's future plan is to take her master's degree. Hala is applying for a loan to help her to cover her semester fees. Her father and grandfather are traders.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is responsible mother of two children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 14 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to do the maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Asia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Asia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. 

Asia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Asia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi which needs regular maintenance

loans.name: Hum

texts.en:
Hum is a 38-year-old, married factory worker with three children and lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has been working in the factory for over five years. Her husband is a 32-year-old construction worker and also a rice farmer. Two of her three children attend school. 

Hum and her husband can earn a daily income of $11. 

Now she is requesting a loan for her husband to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses. This loan will help her husband have enough fertilizer for rice cultivation, so he will be able to gain better rice crops to support the family. 

In the future, she wants to buy ducks and chickens for her husband to fatten at home, save money to build a new house and help her children in earning higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 36 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her clothing and milling business, which deals in clothes and also provides milling services. 

To help expand her business, Oliver  has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more skirts,t shirts, dresses for sale and groundnuts for milling.  It will help Oliver to generate greater profits and earn an income. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Oliver  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: purchase more skirts, t shirts, dresses for sale and groundnuts for milling

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en:
Hafez is a 44-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He used to work in the construction business and he had his own business in this domain. Besides his business, he had a small poultry farm which is his hobby. 

Throughout the years, his poultry farm started to develop and the number of chicken started to increase, so he started five years ago selling chickens and now he has his own customers and a good reputation among his region. On the other side, he set his construction tools to rent.

Hafez is a hard worker and ambitious man, who enjoy poultry farming and wants to develop it more, thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise, with more chickens which will help him satisfy his customers' increasing requests.  He also wants to start a new business of cattle farming.

Hafez hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of improving his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with more chickens and to start a new business of cattle farming
